text:
I have finally time to write this long overdue review for the Villas Tejakula. I've stayed at the villas twice, once in September 2017 and the last time in April 2019. Both times I've had an amazing holiday at the resort. I have stayed in a lot of different hotels all over the world and I am currently studying hospitality management, so I do have some experience regarding hotels (professionally and personally). The villas are definitely one of the best resorts I've ever stayed in. The reason the villas are so exceptional is not the  delicious food or the beautiful surroundings (which are both awesome nevertheless). What differentiates the villas from other hotels is their exceptional attitude and service. The whole stay is on an extremely personal level, the staff and managers are so welcoming and you feel right at home. The number one aim of everyone is for their guests to have an amazing stay and not to make as much profit as possible. Their guests are their number one priority, which is very rare nowadays. For example Wayan stops by at dinner to chat with her guests and connects different people with each other, especially when you are a solo traveller. Budi is very helpful when you want to book follow-up trips and will get you discounts. They have really become friends to me and I am really looking forward to returning to Bali and the villas in the future! 
Other than that Tejakula is truly a beautiful place on its own. I really loved that it is not so busy and touristy than Kuta and other places in Bali. When you are walking around on the street people will greet you and talk to you (wishing you a good day, not trying to sell you a Bintang shirt). It is a truly special place.
You can read a lot about the infrastructure, hardware and look at pictures of the hotel online. But what pictures won't tell you is the atmosphere and the interpersonal connections you can build here. Many hotels have a five star interior, but lack focusing on their guests. The staff at the villas will do anything to make your stay as memorable as possible.So I highly recommend this place!
All the best to Wayan and Budi and the rest of the staff, I hope to see you soon!
Nora from Germany
title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in

owner_response.text:

Thank you so much for sharing your experience with future travellers and we look forward to welcoming you back again in the near future. In the meantime sampai jumpa lagi.

text: We had a week long stay at the Villas, a group of 7 for a family holiday over New Year. WOW what a wonderful experience - the place was absolutely divine in every way! The Villas environment is perfect for a feel of private yet invited, with beautiful calm surroundings and a wonderful local touch. Just 25m swim out from the shore of the hotel are the most beautiful coral and sea life to explore, with snorkel gear provided by the Villas. The food was so delicious, with fresh catch of the day a must when you visit! The staff were so warm and friendly, making us feel most welcome from the minute we stepped through the gates (we arrived later than expected, into the evening, and they graciously stayed up to wait for our arrival). Thank you to Wayan, Budi, Iluh and all the staff for an unforgettable stay at The Villas Tejakula.
title: Friendly and beautiful experience - HIGHLY RECOMMEND STAYING HERE

text:
Thank you to the owners Budi and Wayan for their outstanding family friendly villas. We really felt we'd found a little oasis: our own pool, superior separate rooms, dining area, kitchen and plenty of sunshine traps to relax in. A plentiful supply of drinks from our own fridge freezer too so that we could laze around the pool without having to venture too far for a drink. 

However a short hop to their open air restaurant area provided exceptional meals - breakfast, midday and evening meals available. Service always with a super smile, everybody that works with Budi and Wayan are soooooo lovely. Views across the sea to die for whilst enjoy food and drink. 

Trips/taxi service can be organised by Wayan and Budi will at times drive you. We took excursions to the scuba diving - 20 minutes up the road and went on the dolphin watching trip (an early morning start, and well worth the effort). 

We really can't thank Budi and Wayan enough for giving us such a super break. I definitely recommend a stay there if you want to get away from a busy busy life - you'll be rejuvinated. 

I mustn't forget that you can also get a massage too whilst there. Our daughter really felt the benefits of a deep massage.
title: An Oasis of Luxury

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We had a lovely stay at The Villas Tejakula. It is even more beautiful than the pictures! The villas are setup with two private king rooms separated by a beautiful outdoor common area and kitchen with a shared pool. We booked one king room, but no one was staying in the other room so we had an entire villa to ourselves with our own private pool. It was just beautiful. The rooms are gorgeous and the staff have thought of every detail. The kitchen is stocked with coffee, tea, wine, beer, and sodas. Beach towels are provided, and there is mosquito spray in the rooms, although we rarely needed it, there were very few mosquitoes during our stay. 
The lodge is located on the northern coast, which is quiet, not very touristy, and perfect for a relaxing getaway. Wayan emailed us after we made our reservations to provide us with a lot of helpful information. It is roughly a 3 hour drive from the airport, but Wayan and her husband Budi helped us organize tours of Lake Beratan and Ubud on our trips to and from the airport, which was a great way to see other parts of the island. And the whole drive is just spectacular, with volcanoes and rice fields and plenty of temples to see. They also offer several day tours, but the hotel was so beautiful we decided to spend most of our time relaxing there. We enjoyed the beautiful on-site open air restaurant overlooking the beach (I highly recommended the pizza, BBQ pork ribs, and the banana pancakes!) We booked a dive with the resort next door in their house reef, which was amazing. It’s also a great area for snorkeling, but be sure to pack water shoes because the black sand beach is beautiful but very rocky. Wayan also organized a traditional Balinese fishing trip for us, where we saw many dolphins and managed to catch a small tuna that the staff cooked us for dinner that evening. We also took full advantage of the on site spa, the massages were wonderful. All of the staff were so friendly and attentive. It was an amazing trip and we’re already talking about planning a return visit! I definitely recommend!
title: Beautiful Accommodations, Amazing Location

text: I have been meaning to post this for a while but time has got away from me.  Last April I was incredibly lucky to stay for three amazing days Villas Tejakula.  My husband and I had previously stayed at the Villa Saraswati where we had the great fortune to meet the owners of both properties. We hadn’t booked accommodation for the last three days of our holiday and lucky for us we hadn’t, because we would have missed out on a truly incredible experience. For my husband and I, it was the perfect romantic getaway. Our Villa was just superb with a beautifully decorated bedroom and bathroom, private pool and exquisite courtyard kitchen living area for relaxing. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to assist us.  Check in was personalized and a breeze.  The grounds at the resort were stunning; so serene and tranquil.  There is a fabulous restaurant located on the property situated close to the sea. This place is absolutely stunning and a perfect place to relax, reconnect and revitalize your soul. If you a looking for a tranquil setting and a more authentic Balinese experience with incredible service then this is the place to come.
title: Tranquil getaway

text:
We have really enjoyed our five nights at The Villas Tejakula.  We stayed here for five nights of our two week honeymoon - what a choice.  As soon as we arrived, beauty, tranquillity and adventure were the keywords for this part of our trip.

Upon our arrival, the bed had been decorated with fresh flowers and a happy honeymoon message.  Recognising that we were on honeymoon, the amazing Wayan and Budi arranged for us to have our complex all to ourselves, a gesture which shows the nature of their attention to detail and work to ensure our stay was perfect!

The team here is lovely, and recommended a great range of activities. We would thoroughly recommend a visit to Les and Sekumpul waterfalls. Wayan put us in contact with her brother Nyoman who rented us a motorbike to help us get around. It made for some romantic daytrips past rice paddies and coastal roads.

Other things to note - the pool is great and gets warmed by the sun, the room is a good size with plenty of strorage space, and there is aircon and a ceiling fan which are effective at keeping the room cool.

If you are looking for a stay away from the hustle and bustle, this is it!
title: Honeymoon getaway

text:
A lovely piece of Paradise at The Villas in Tejakula just next to the sea. 
We stayed there for four days and we loved it. The Villas are very private and calm. Although you can have your breakfast right at seaside, there is no beach near the villas, but the private and very clean swimmingpool is just a few steps from the bedroom of your villa/room. Diving and snorkelling is available from the hotel. The rooms are beautyfully equipped with original Balinese furniture and modern art. The cleaning and the service is very good. The menu card has a good variety of chicken, pork and fish. We particularly loved the ‘Spring rolls’, the BBQ ribs and the ‘Gorengs’. The staff will suggest a dish, like: ‘we just bought fresh tuna, would you like to try it tonight?’ We never regretted that we followed their suggestion. 
The managers, Wayan and Budy, and all their staff are very friendly and help you plan excursions, book massage, driver, etc. The last day, Budy was our driver and gave us an adventurous drive through the mountains, to the Besakih temple, to a restaurant with the most magnificent view, to a wood carpenter and silver smith and, finally, to our last hotel on this trip to Bali. It was a great pleasure to get to know Budy better. He is very nice to talk with and has a lovely humour and laugh. 
You easily get the feeling that you are in good company when you talk with both Wayan and Budy and their friendly staff. 
In The Villas they say: ‘you come as guests and leave as friends’. So true, thank you 🙏.
title: A lovely piece of Paradise

text: It is very hard to add to all the other reviews on this place (including my own). This is my fifth stay here and upon arrival I'm immediately reminded why my heart longs for this sanctuary when back home. My wife and I were treated with 3 perfect sunny days, where the visibility for snorkelling was the best it's ever been, the mango smoothie with breakfast was sublime!, the massages were superb, and the staff impeccable. We were treated like old friends from the moment we arrived. This place is so private and is perfectly crafted to give you relaxing and rejuvenating downtime. title: Perfect stay

text:
Well what can I say that has not already been said ? Not a lot maybe.  Budi and Wayan and the whole team are awesome hosts - the villas really are beautiful and more than that the stay is magical.

My recommendations on what to do ?
- the waterfalls in nearby town are lovely, worth a visit
- a hike up Mt Batur is well worth the early start
- diving on USAT Liberty is you are a diver is a must do - but get there early
- massage and yoga in the villa is splendid

So you can be sure you will have a lovely time.  Most of all the welcome and the care & professionalism of the team will ensure you leave wanting more
title: Fantastic stay - treated like family - well recommended !!!

text: We stayed at 6 different locations around Bali and this was by far the best. An extremely hardworking, friendly team demonstrated the most outstanding customer service we have ever received. The Villas are absolute perfection and the location is stunning, views whilst eating dinner over the sea are amazing! Pool is lovely and the outdoor lounge area is bliss. The food is delicious and the spa massages are excellent. Highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Bali. Contact the hotel and they will arrange transport to get you there from anywhere in Bail. Trust me when I say it’s worth the trip, you will not regret it. We named this part of our trip ‘Paradise’ as it could not have been any better! Thank you to the amazing team.
title: Paradise!

text:
We wanted to experience real Bali, away from the crowds and we found this beautiful property expertly run by Budi and Wayan. The staff to guest ratio alone would put many 5 star hotels to shame. With a maximum of 16 guests at any one time spread over 4, 2-bedroom villas, this is the ideal spot for people to completely relax in a calming environment with superb sea views and extremely attentive and professional hospitality.

The villas themselves have been designed in a traditional Balinese style with 2 master bedrooms/bathrooms, a lovely open air seating/kitchen area and a beautiful pool. They are only 4 years old and maintained to a very high standard. Fixtures, fittings and linens are all a very high quality. The Warung Kelapa (see separate review) anchors the property and the lovely gardens overlook the sea. The spa services are excellent value and expertly delivered. The included breakfast is probably one of the best we have ever had worldwide. The views over the ocean are amazing and the very attentive service from Darma was impeccable. It is a multi-course offering so allow time to relax and do it justice. Fresh juices, fruits and smoothies are followed by a choice of eggs, bacon, tomatoes and the most amazing homemade baked beans. This is then followed by beautiful thin pancakes. if you give them 24hrs notice you can order a fabulous Balinese breakfast.

It is in a secluded beachfront location but the adjacent Dive Resort (Teluk Kerang) offers alternative dining if required and it is around 15 mins walk to the main road and 20 mins to the early morning market. The transfer from South Bali and the airport is around 3.5hrs and the scenery en-route is spectacular.

We must finally mention the wonderful staff again. There is a useful profile of them and their family in the room and their training has clearly been of a high standard and their command of the English language is brilliant. Don’t come here if you want nightlife and entertainment. Please come here if you want to completely des-stress, listen to the waves and enjoy luxurious surroundings in a beautiful setting, looked after by attentive staff.
title: Tranquil luxury in North Bali

owner_response.text:

Until we meet again - safe and happy travelling.
Best wishes
Wayan, Budi
& The Staff at The Villas Tejakula

text:
I stayed here for 8 days at the end of April and to get away from work. Right away, the staff was extremely welcoming. I had forgotten to pack toiletries so they drove me to several stores to pick them up. I was lucky to have the whole villa to myself the whole time. Everything was so clean and the pool deliciously refreshing. The whole place has a soothing, gentle vibe. I ate every day at the restaurant. The food was amazingly fresh and flavorful, I gained my appetite after months. I loved having daily spa treatments while listening to the sound of the waves. I highly recommend dolphin sight seeing at sunrise as well as diving into the reef, just 10 metres away from the restaurant. 

Budi and Wayan were always kind and helpful. In many ways, I feel like they treated me as one of their own rather than a guest in a hotel. I'm not sure I even want to call this place a resort, it really goes beyond what I have ever experienced.
title: Best place for rejuvanation

text:

The beach is just next to the resort's restaurant, great weather. 
Keep it up! 
Rafik & Nadia
title: The best honeymoon location

text: My wife and I came to the Villas Tejakula for some much needed R&R, and what a place to do it. Situated away from the hustle and bustle in northern Bali is the Villas Tejakula. We were lucky enough to have a private villa on our own, with our own living area and beautiful pool. Days were spent eating delicious food in the on-site Warung Kelapa, reading books by the ocean and the pool, snorkelling, trekking into the mountains to see idyllic waterfalls, receiving superb in-house massages and sleeping in a gorgeous four-poster king bed, quietly cooled by an expert air-conditioning unit and fans. It is obvious no expense was spared in the construction and running of these villas and it's the little things that have you arriving as guests and leaving as friends: free water, private Wi-Fi devices, mobile telephones to use, private fridge to use (stocked), an inclusive breakfast so large and diverse, sarongs to wear, and incredible management where nothing is too much. I have been here many times and I cannot stop coming back. Simply superb.
title: It's the little things...

text: For an authentic Bali experience far from the typical tourist areas head north to the beautiful Villas at Tejakula. You will not be disappointed if you want time to ground yourself in Bali authenticity. Don't come here if you want wall to wall tourist shopping and hustle bustle. Do come here if you want rest, relaxation, excellent accommodations, and a Staff that pampers you with real Bali kindness and hospitality. The 3 1/2 hour trek to get here from the airport is an excursion in itself so save your money and just go stay here! Unbelievable experience. highly recommend!
title: The Real Bali experience

text:
We stayed at The Villas for 6 nights, and it was indeed an unforgettable experience.
The villa itself is very spacious with king-size bed, large bathroom and a nice common area with a lovely pool (we shared it with one other couple, however we were the only users of it).

The restaurant offers a lot of different options, including western food like burgers and pizzas, however we would recommend the local dishes for sure. 
So tasty and perfectly cooked. 

We used the hotel services a lot, like taxi and massage, and we were always completely satisfied with the top-dollar professionalism and friendly attitude of the staff. 
Pricing was reasonable and the price mark-up compared to local options is justified, due to the convenience of the services right outside your doorstep.

The Villas are perfectly situated for exploring the north side of Bali, and the likes of Mount Batur, Sekumpul waterfall, Lovina Beach, etc., but we also managed to do a one-day trip to Ubud (2 hours by car)

Finally, a big thank you to Budi, Wayan and the staff for making our stay better than we could possibly hope for. 

We will definitely return, should we ever visit Bali again. 

Best regards,
Anders and Malene
title: Hidden gem with an outstanding service level

owner_response.text:

When we receive such a wonderful review it is our greatest reward.  You said we gave you an unforgettable experience with our personalised attention, the beautiful accommodation, our superb location, perfectly cooked food plus what makes it all come together - an amazing team of staff who do their best to ensure your stay is the best that it can be.   To have all this acknowledged and praised is a welcome experience for us and one thankfully that we receive time and time again.

Thank you so much for sharing your experience with future travellers and we look forward to welcoming you both back again in the near future.   In the meantime travel safely until we meet again.

owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
What has not been said?  We spent 6 nights at The Villas Tejakula - the perfect place to relax and unwind in a fabulous setting.  

The accommodation is spacious and has everything you could want and it is spotlessly clean.  There are four sets of two rooms each with a shared living area and pool.  During our stay we had the luxury of privacy as we were the only guests.  Unfortunately, there have been fewer guests since the threatened eruption of the volcano.

Wayan and Budi were kindness itself and so easy to chat to.  Although we haven't mentioned everyone by name all the staff were keen to help and talk to us and always with a smile.  Ketut tried very hard to teach us some Balinese including giving us a crib sheet. The massages by Iluh were wonderful as was the food, especially when it was eaten sitting by the sea with the waves breaking close by.  The spring rolls were amazing.

Book now - you will never find a more restful and relaxing place and such wonderful hosts as Wayan and Budi.
title: Book now!

owner_response.text:
Dear Cilgwyn,
We laughed out loud when we read your heading "BOOK NOW" and so appreciated that you still came to stay regardless of the possibility of an eruption with Mt Agung.     It is still all quiet at the moment and we hope that your wonderful review will encourage more guests to travel to Bali and, once here, to make the journey to the North Coast through the beautiful island and to stay with us in our magical peaceful part of Bali.
We look forward to your return - do not make it too long.

text:
Having just returned from a 3 night stay at Villa Tejakula, I can honestly say that our whole experience was the perfect finale to our travel through Indonesia. 
I last visited Bali nearly 30 years ago so I was a bit concerned that I would be disappointed by mass tourism and commercialism but Villa Tejakula restored my confidence that areas of authentic Bali still remain. 

The location of the property is unbeatable. We enjoyed a beautiful sea breeze in manicured gardens and we were able to readily interact with friendly locals going about their daily life. We were constantly greeted by big smiles and a chorus of happy children.

Every part of our stay was handled with perfection from our initial contact with the Villa Tejakula, to our transfers, tours, accommodation and food. We had two adjoining villas, they were spotlessly clean and beautifully appointed. We also had a great private pool which we used a lot because access into the ocean is a bit rocky. The resort is next to a dive shop which my daughters utilised so it was very convenient.

The restaurant on site has excellent, well priced food and drinks which was an unexpected, welcome bonus. We made use of the spa and my massage could not have been better.

We travelled as a family of 5 adults and in order to do this we booked direct which I would highly recommend.

Without doubt the best part of our stay was the wonderful staff. Wayan is an absolute gem, so organised and efficient! Together with her husband, Budi and the entire staff they made sure our stay was very special. The staff were so friendly and did a fantastic job.

Thank you Villa Tejakula for a wonderful stay and for providing an oasis that allowed us to experience the natural beauty of Bali and the wonderful, genuine  friendliness of the Balinese.
title: Perfect in every way!

text:
Considering the wide range of expectations that our family of six adults hoped to fulfill within two weeks, these holidays could be likened to a wonder.

Starting with the very beginning: the transfer we have booked was perfectly organised. What a pleasure, after a long flight, to find our driver welcoming us with a smile, cool water and a comfortable car for the smooth three-hour ride through a dramatic landscape…

… to arrive finally in paradise. Set in a peaceful area far away from the touristic crowds, that Balinese family-owned, small-sized resort awaited us with lush vegetation around and a manicured garden edging the waterfront. All right, there is no real sandy beach around and you might need water shoes, but you’ll have instead a pure 180-degree horizon view with only sea, sun and sky. 
The accommodation, luxurious with tasteful Balinese flair, was in the same vein. Each 2-bedroom villa had its own courtyard with pool and exotic garden, high-quality beds and dark wood furniture, AC and fan, huge bathroom and rain shower, all amenities perfectly cleaned by a daily room service.

The setting is one thing, the contents might be another. But there again, the variety of activities offered was almost endless, including diving or snorkeling by the front door in the turquoise water, boating before dinner (and eat the tuna you caught), strolling through the village to the colourful local market in the early morning, sightseeing in the surroundings or laying lazy in the sun all day long on a deck chair. Not to forget the wonderful massages, from head to feet, from hot stones to scrub, one can choose to soothe the body after so much effort! 

So that, at the end of such days, we sat happy and hungry in the lovely, open-air restaurant and enjoyed the local homemade food, from BBQ spare ribs to fish curries or veggies & tofu, including special wishes like gluten-free club sandwiches… And close the evenings on our own terrace, with some wines from our daily filled “maxi-fridge” minibar, listening to music (better download at home as the Wifi can be capricious) and looking at the stars or jumping in our pool for a midnight bath!

But what makes the Villas Tejakula a truly unique place is not the beautiful location, the service-oriented philosophy, the very fair price/quality ratio, the peaceful and high-relaxing rhythm of life there. It is the exceptional and genuine kindness of the whole team and especially of Wayan and her husband Budi who run the place with an ever-ready smile and an infinite patience.
Thank you so much for the wonderful time we had. We look forward to seeing you again!
title: Beyond expectations

text:
We, me and my husband Paul, stayed in a deluxe room at The Villas Tejakula for 7 days recently and the experience was more than we could have ever hoped for.

Our arrival was quite late(around 9 pm), after a long journey from Austria and we were really tired. Especially because the transfer from the airport took us around 4 hours, because thick fog on the road along mt batur slowed us down significantly...I just mention this because -in hindsight- we would maybe plan to get to bali a bit earlier or rather stay in kuta for a day, before heading to the Villas, to get a look at the vulcano on the way!

Tired as we were, the warm welcome we encountered at the Villas was all that we could have hoped for! They even offered to make us a cheese and bacon sandwich to make up for the fact that we had missed dinner time :) (if you come there you have to try it!!! It tasted like heaven on earth, even though i have to admit that at this point i was so hungry everything would have tasted quite good^^)

Our room, as well as the bedroom and the shower were a lot more spacious than I had expected, based on the photographs i had seen so far and everything was so nicely decorated with flowers for our arrival, we almost felt bad to destroy it, when we went to sleep. 

What really blew us away the next morning was the pool, that we shared with another couple! We couldn't have dreamed for anything better!

Breakfast is also a treat ;) served at the adjacent Warung, the highlights are clearly the banana pancakes and the fresh fruit juices, but everything is very tasty! There is also the option to order balinese breakfast, but you have to do it 24 hrs in advance...

Speaking of food we started our week, dining at the warung and were so impressed, that we never considered going anywhere else ;) They serve a variety of cocktails for every taste and you are seated right next to the sea which adds to the wonderful atmosphere<3 if you want to add some romance there is also the option for a dinner for two in the pavillion, which we can highly recommend! 

We never got a spa treatment, so we can not say anything regarding the massages, but we met the masseuse and she seemed extremely nice. If it hadn't been for the tours we arranged for the last three days, we would have gotten treatment there for sure^^

Regarding the tours, we can especially recommend the boat tour. Even though we didn't catch anything, the view and the awesome feeling of gliding through the smooth water with a traditional fishing boat were unforgettable!

We have read a lot of reviews, here on trip advisor and as some "helpful reviewers" have pointed out: there is no tv in the room  and no community pool. Even though i don't quite get the point of a community pool when you have a semi-private/private pool just 5 metres outside your door and tvs are available upon request, but thats a matter of taste!

I think if you are staying at the villas and expect a place where you can party all night you will be disappointed! However, since this wasn't our objective we couldn't have had a more pleasant stay. It's the right place for everyone looking for something quiet and relaxing with amazing food and a lot of privacy, paired with excellent service and beautiful surroundings!

The Wifi doesn't work in the rooms and only in the living area, which might be a problem to some (if only temporarily^^ they were working hard on a solution when we left! We don't think it will take longer than 1-2weeks to have wifi access throughout the property again...) but we didn't mind! We are used to being available non stop, so this was a nice  change :)

What really sets this experience apart from other places we have stayed in, was the more than friendly service! The whole staff is extremely welcoming and so helpful, they make you feel right at home :) -a luxurious home- but a home nonetheless! Special shoutout to Wayan and Budi the managers, who made our stay as perfect as we wanted it to be and helped us with the tour booking! 

The only thing we regrett is not booking for longer! We will come back again as soon as possible!

Lena and Paul
title: A perfect honeymoon location!

You did not want to leave and we did not want you to either as we had all enjoyed the experience of meeting and taking care of you during your stay with us.

text:
I would recommend you to round up your Bali trip with this hotel, to have a few days escape from the busy Bali city life of Ubud, Seminyak....etc.  

Villa Tejakula located at the end of a local village beside the sea. While enjoying the privacy from your luxurious villa, you are still able to experience the village life in Bali. 
Tejakula is a place unspoiled by tourism in Bali relatively, you would be greeted by the curious but friendly villagers when you walk out from the hotel. When taking a walk outside the villa, you would bump into a lot of chicken, and meet the local children busy showing off their kites or biking skill to foreigners. 

You feel so peaceful with the village life especially after experienced the touristic Bali cities. No one here in Tejakula greeted you with purpose at least. 

During my visit, the village was holding Hindu ceremony for a deceased villager. You get to hear their chanting every night (I heard from the villa’s host that the chanting for deceased will last for a few days and it’s normal practice for villagers in Bali. It would stop before your bed time though), and they had ceremony at the temple right beside the villa during day time. The chanting and singing were not bordering at all if you have an open-mind. To me, that was some real exotic experience and I think that’s what travel meant for.   

There is zero light pollution in Tejakula. My husband and I were lucky enough to have clear sky at night during our stay, we saw shooting stars almost every ten minutes and a very obvious milky way too. So make sure you have appropriate star-gazing apps downloaded before checking in Villa Tejakula. 

Villa Tejakula is a small villa with 8 rooms only. So the hosts remember everyone’s requests and you get to enjoy some personal touch from the hosts.  I mentioned once in my correspondence with Wayan that it was my husband’s birthday on the fourth night of our stay. She took initiative to decorate our room on the day and made us a birthday cake at dinner time. Wayan and her husband Budi greet the guests every morning during breakfast time and make sure that all is well with the guests. I appreciate their effort and kindness very much.  

We also love to read the brochure introducing all the hotel staffs too (from hotel managers to security guard and gardener). Most of them had worked for other resorts at the cities, and now they have a chance to come back to Tejakula and work closer to their home near the villa and take care of their children after work. 
You can see how this rare luxurious villa located at the heart of local villages meant something to the staffs, and perhaps this is the reason why the staffs all look happy and energetic working at the villa.     

There’s practically nothing you can do at Villa Tejakula except star gazing, snorkelling, diving, sunbathing, reading and eating…. You can book a massage and they can also arrange yoga class for guests. You may take 10 to 15 minutes walk to some local shops for grocery (do not expect supermarket), or enjoy some real cheap local food from the food stalls along the road (we had Mie Ayam at less than USD1)

There are a few minor things that I wish the villa can improve. First, they may consider installing a telephone inside the room, so the guests can request something from their room without walking all the way to the restaurant area. They may even order in-room dining when getting too lazy so that the private pantry area would not be wasted. Secondly, their wifi service needs serious improvement; I went to the diving resort next door for dinner and their wifi was excellent and stable. So remoteness should not be an obstacle for stable wifi. Thirdly, I hope there would be more snorkelling shoes in women size (common size from 37 to 40). 

Other than that, nothing to complain about and I enjoyed my stay a lot. Do not forget to ask the host to arrange a tour along with your way to the Villa Tejakula from the city, so to make the three hours drive more worthwhile and interesting.
title: Great escape from busy Bali city centre

owner_response.text:
Dear Lamfa,
We so enjoyed having you both to stay with us on your recent Bali holiday and were delighted that your husband celebrated his Birthday with us as well.    You both embraced the unique experience of leaving the busy tourist areas behind and exploring a lesser known area of Bali.   It is one that gives you a more intimate experience of our island and the upside is a quieter and more peaceful environment, wonderfully clear skies that give you a panorama to enjoy at night, beautiful sunrises and sunsets and happy smiling village people.    
You will be pleased to know that we have replenished our selection of Reef Shoes so that we now have all shoes sizes catered for.
The patchy Wi Fi is out of control but we have now purchased more Modems so that guests can have a connection whenever they wish.    We appreciate that this contact is essential in today's world and we are doing our best to solve the problem until the Fibre Optic is in place.  
Thank you once again for taking the time to write such a wonderful review and share so much of your experience.   Time and again guests say that they chose to stay with us because of our reviews, but sadly very few of them take the time to share their experience as well.
We look forward to welcoming you both back to The Villas Tejakula.   Travel safely.
Best wishes
Wayan, Budi & The Staff at The Villas Tejakula

text: We needed a break from the bustle of Ubud, and were we rewarded! Tejakula is a quiet non- touristy spot on the north east coast of Bali. The Villas are organised across 4 garden 'compounds each with 2 large beautiful rooms and a private pool. There is a kitchen and open living area between the 2 rooms. You can book one or both rooms. Absolutely beautiful high grade linen and towels, outdoor furniture and sun lounges. A maximum of 16 guests at any one time. There are coral beds that can be accessed from the rocky beach. title: Nice place

text:
After 2 years since our last visit, the Villas Tejakula did not disappoint and in fact surpassed our previous excellent stay. From the moment we arrived Budi, Wayan and the staff made us feel comfortable and welcome taking the time to show us our immaculate villa, which was to be our home for the next week, and updating us on the new facilities since our last visit. Warung Kelapa is the restaurant attached to the Villas and serves delicious meals from the freshest produce available and wide selection. Extensions to the Warung have given more capacity for guests to enjoy the absolute waterfront position and food was delivered quickly and wait staff always on hand to make sure everything was good.
The Spa is located in the garden area and takes advantage of the breeze and the sound of the waves on the beach. The therapist (Iluh) is very good and we had multiple treatments during our stay.
The enthusiasm and friendliness of the staff and their pride in their part of the team makes for a wonderful holiday. With great snorkelling, diving, fishing and excursions at the doorstep you can be as busy or relaxed as you like. 
Thanks to Budi and Wayan, Made(Super Chef) Weda, Gede, Darma and Iluh. Also thanks to Ketut, Made, Dana, Sri and Gede for maintaining the Villas and grounds to such a high standard and ensuring we are safe and secure.
Totally enjoyed our return visit and looking forward to next year. 🙏🙏
title: Sparkling Gem on Bali's North Coast

owner_response.text:
Dear Brian and G,
After a number of stays with us over the years we now feel that you are well and truly family and we look forward to your visits.   Thank you so much for sharing your thoughts on Trip Advisor and we will work hard to find even more improvements to impress you with before your next visit.    
Travel safely on your extended holiday and Budi, I and all of the staff look forward to your next holiday at The Villas Tejakula.
Best wishes,
Wayan Parniti 
The Villas Tejakula
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: My husband and I have lived in Asia for several years, but this was our first time to Bali. We knew we wanted something away from tourists and something small. Well we found paradise!!!! The owners Wayan and Budi are so kind. They make you feel like family. Being our first time to Bali, I was a little nervous and did a lot of planning. I emailed Wayan several times confirming pickups, currency exchange, and tours. Even before we arrived Wayan was great at answering all my questions and making me feel comfortable with our trip. When we arrived, I knew we had chosen the perfect place! The villas are really beautifully decorated. It's so nice having your own pool! If you are unsure about sharing the villa with someone else, don't be nervous! It's still so private and intimate. My husband and I spent a lot of time just reading around the pool because it was so relaxing and at night you can lay outside and star gaze. The beach is very lovely as well. It's a rocky beach with black sand but I have never seen water so clean. The water just feels refreshing as well. I have been to a lot of beaches in Asia and this one by far had the best water. Also the sunsets are the best! I have never seen sunsets so beautiful and dramatic. I loved it! The staff is extremely friendly. My husband and I both have gluten intolerance and they got us gluten free bread. This is the first place that I have ever been that has catered to our food needs. The food is the best we have ever had. It's better than top notch restaurants. The tuna is so fresh! You must try their balinese specials that they have each day. Breakfast is huge! I have never ate so much on a vacation, but it was worth it! Also, I loved waking up and seeing Darma's smiling face. He is so nice and sweet to his customers. Wede is very attentive to all of your needs as well. Also, you must get a massage! In sum, I can't recommend staying here enough. I am already thinking about our next trip here!!!!
title: Wow!!! An unbelievable place!

owner_response.text:
Dear Shellray12,
Thank you so much for taking the time to write this wonderful review. You found us via Trip Advisor as so many of guests do and it is especially wonderful that you have shared your experience with other travellers by way of your review.
It was sad say goodbye when you left after your 6 nights with us but we are thrilled that you are already planning to return. 
As you are already aware we are a small Boutique Hotel with only a total of 8 rooms but we have wonderful staff who love working together to give each of our guests personalised but unobtrusive attention to ensure they have a great holiday experience with us. 
We often say that "you may arrive as our guests, but you will leave as our new friends" and it is obvious that you feel that way as well. Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us, to write this review and to return again soon. We all look forward to welcoming you back to The Villas Tejakula.
Best wishes,
Wayan, Budi and all of the Staff at
The Villas Tejakula.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: Stay as long as you can!  We booked this as a side trip after a wedding in Singapore and were sad as soon as we got there that we didn't plan to stay longer. It's difficult to describe how perfect this place is.  The reason we always look for smaller villa-type places to stay is the personal interaction and service and we were not disappointed.  Budi and Wayan were the perfect hosts and made sure we were taken care of.  The room, the pool, the outdoor living area of our villa were all amazing and the perfect place to relax.  We had all of our meals at the restaurant and they were great, freshly prepared and served by delightful staff.  The massage was amazing as well. There are 2 routes to the villas from the airport.  Make sure you take both of them as you arrive and leave.  They both have interesting sights.  Our driver stopped along the way to let us take in some of the sights.
title: Don't stay 3 days

owner_response.text:
Dear Vicki W,
We were also sorry that you had only three days to spend with us.    This is the comment that we hear so often when guests have booked for 2 or 3 nights and then just do not want to leave.   That in itself is a great reward for all of the Staff at The Villas Tejakula as it lets us know that we have all done our jobs well and have made you feel so pampered and spoilt.   We pride ourselves that our guests feel like new friends when they finally depart and it is often a sad day to say goodbye.
We look forward to your next stay with us and hopefully you can manage to make it longer next time.
Best wishes,
Wayan Parniti
The Villas Tejakula
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We felt welcomed and cared for from the moment we arrived.  Wayan greeted us most enthusiastically accompanied by what appeared to be the entire staff.  The Villa (Ganesha) was peaceful and quiet.  The pool, inviting.  Everything we needed was there including a sarong to use as a cover-up.

Breakfast is a multi course adventure - the "pancake" is a delightful crepe.  Dinner menu has great variety with classic local dishes.  Do not leave without having an iced mochacchino.  If you are lucky you might merit a birthday cake made by Weda.  If you are longing for something western to eat, try the "pizza" a foodies delight.

Take the walk to the local market in the early morning to drink in the local flavor, it is worth the walk.  On the way back, keep an eye out for the play yard at the local school.  It is quite a site when the entire school is doing morning stretch.
title: A Hidden Gem

text: I was headed up North in Bali to meet some local friends, and came upon the Villa's on Trip Advisor.  What a great surprise.  For a small fraction of what I paid to stay in a tiny Villa in Nusa Dua, Villas Tejakula offers absolutely gorgeous, large, impeccably furnished Villa's, each with a large private pool, an indoor out door living room and master bath, and complete privacy.  The small public area is also quite nice, with meals served beside the water, and the owners and staff are delightful.   There is nothing not to recommend about Villa's Tejakula for a hideaway in a relatively obscure, non-touristy, and completely unspoiled part of Bali along the North Coast.  There's good swimming and decent snorkeling in front of the Villas, but don't expect a sand beach or spectacular reefs anywhere along this part of the Coast.
title: Unbelievably Nice Hideaway at a Great Value

text: Couple of days  in bali we chose The Villas Tejak for our rest night.The room and bath room was clean with a friendly staff.So we really enjoyed our relaxing.Their provide hot and cold shower.This is perfect accommodations for us.And highly recommend to everyone who want come to bali chose this Villa.
title: Perfect Resting

text: The owners, Buti and Wayan, are very interested and active in making your experience at their resort fantastic. The on-site meals are to die for and the Balinese massages are incredible. We stayed for 4 days and did not want to leave. The villas are beautiful and every detail has been thought out for you. There are too many amenities to list. Each villa has a private pool that was the highlight of our visit. It is very interesting that they have prayers and make offerings three times a day. We would see incense with offerings outside our villa every time we left. They said they prayed for each of their guests. We loved their warmth and hospitality. We can't wait to return to do it all again.
title: Great Food, Great Service, and Hospitality

text:
We stayed at The Villas Tejakula for 5 nights as part of our honeymoon. 

We were looking for a place to stay by the sea to follow on from a few busy days in Ubud and the villas sounded perfect. 

You can truly unwind here. It is a quiet part of Bali so don't expect night clubs and shopping but that is part of its charm.

Situated between the mountains and the sea it is in a beautiful spot. There is very good snorkelling from the beach right by the restaurant. The Villas themselves are finished to the highest standard and are very comfortable and inviting. As good as any five-star resort with the added bonus of a laid-back vibe. 

Wayan and Budi and all of the staff are wonderful and made us feel so welcome. There is an in-house spa offering a wide range of treatments. What better way to relax than have a massage with the sound of waves in the background.

The food is definitely worth a mention from the plentiful breakfast to the lunch/ dinner menu - it is very varied offering western and Indonesian choices and all cooked from fresh. Particular favourites were the Balinese chicken and mahi-mahi (fish)

We hired a scooter for the day. We headed east to go snorkelling at the Liberty wreck and then onto the Amed coast. Also close by is the Les Waterfall which is definitely worth a visit 

All in all we would definitely recommend the Villas as a place to stay to experience the real Bali.
title: A great place to step down a gear

text:
From the moment we arrived we were in paradise! The hotel is gorgeous - the villas and the grounds are the most beautiful design  - the staff could not do more to attend to your every need, the food is truly delicious, the views of ocean and mountains astounding, and the massage services are the best anywhere! 
Congratulations to the staff for creating the most relaxing and gorgeous vacation ! 
Many thanks !
title: Paradise!

text: The villas are superb! The staff are absolutely fantastic and very helpful organising trips and transfers onto other destinations. The rooms are great as are the shared areas with lots of places to relax. I would highly recommend a stay here for couples or families
title: Wonderful place to enjoy some relaxation

text: We had such an amazing time and experience here. Staff were so helpful and kind. Owners were outstanding. Scooter hire is available I would suggest doing this and taking a look around. Food is amazing definitely try the ribs you won't regret it. Spa services is amazing. Thanks for the wonderful stay.
title: Outstanding and beautiful.

text:
It was our first visit to Bali and we spent the first few days in Kuta, which is busy, dirty and expensive, so i wasn't sure what to expect when we arrived at The Villas. Their driver picked us up from our hotel in Kuta and it took us nearly 4 hours to get to Tejakula. It's a nice drive and you get to see a lot of the countryside, however, the roads are narrow, windy and often quite busy so i was very glad that i wasn't driving!

The Villas are the complete contrast to Kuta. Quiet, friendly,clean and relaxing. We were met by Wayan on arrival and she showed us to our room and showed us where all the lights and amenities were in our room and the kitchen area. She asked if i wanted milk for my tea and when i said yes, the milk arrived about 2 minutes later!

The rooms and communal areas are very well cleaned and maintained, as is the pool area. They are meticulous with the cleaning, especially when there is a changeover.

We then had some lunch, even though technically we were a bit late for lunch. The menu is fairly small but has a good and varied selection of food with reasonable prices. During our stay we tried lots of things from the menu; for lunch we had the club sandwich which was lovely, the chicken and sweetcorn soup is really good and the pizzas are also exceptional. The tuna and mahi mahi is also very good. I tried some of the Balinese food which was really nice but maybe a little too spicy for me. They do ask how you would like it but i think that the Balinese idea of not very spicy and mine vary a little! The balinese breakfast is very nice and worth a try as is the Balinese evening meal (requires notice at breakfast i think but worth it)

We also did snorkelling just off the beach area. We saw a good variety of fish, including a lion fish, puffer fish and also a pod of dolphins. The snorkelling is best as the tide goes out and the reef is a little closer to the surface.

If you want somewhere that gets you away from it all and is really quiet and peaceful then this is the place for you. The staff are all lovely and very understanding. they are all eager to help you have the best holiday that you can. The food and drink prices are very reasonable. The massages are wonderful and i had a skin exfoliation treatment and my skin felt really soft afterwards.

We did one of the trips, but mostly just chilled out, slept, read and snorkelled.

The staff are all very welcoming and good at their jobs and their main aim is to make sure that you have a great and relaxing break.

Thank you to all. We arrived feeling tired and stressed and reluctantly went home 7 days later feeling relaxed and chilled out.
title: A lovely place to relax

text:
Beautiful days in a beautiful Villa.
A Dive Center is located next to the hotel.
A spa for good massages are also in the hotel. 

There is a good restaurant in the hotel.

The stuff is more than helpful. They even planned us a trip with a private driver to Nusa Dua where our next Hotel was.

We also saw dolfins in front of the hotel.
title: Beautiful days

owner_response.text:
Dear Stefanie W,
We were thrilled that you enjoyed your stay with us as even though we are a small Boutique Hotel all of our staff work very hard to ensure that every guest is given special attention.  
You were lucky to see the dolphins as it is not a daily event, but does happen from time to time and is always enjoyed tremendously by our guests.
Thank you once again for taking the time to write your review and we look forward to welcoming you back to your home at The Villas Tejakula when you are next in Bali.
Best wishes
Wayan Parniti
Manager
The Villas Tejakula
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: We had an excellent stay in The Villas Tejakula. Wayan, Budi and all the other stuff were so friendly and helpful. We had a perfect stay here at the Villjas. You can do some excellent trips starting here at the hotel. We did a trip to the "Les Waterfall" which is nearby. Its absolutely worth a trip! We had a wonderful guide, which was organized by Wayan. Badly we forgot about the name.
title: Excellent Stay!

owner_response.text:
Dear schubi939,
We were delighted that you chose to spend some of your holiday in Bali with us at The Villas Tejakula.   It is a long way from the Airport, but as you said "worth the trip" as once you are here overlooking the Bali Sea it is very quiet and peaceful and our small team of staff do their best to ensure that all guests receive specialised attention.
We look forward to welcoming you back again when you are next in Bali.
Best wishes,
Wayan & Budi
Managers
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

photos.caption: Private Pool (Sharing of 2 Villas) at night
Private Pool (Sharing by 2 Villas) at day
Special decorated room because of wedding anniversary

text:
Wayan, Budi and all their smiling staff do a wonderful job in welcoming guests at their little resort. We stayed five nights in one of the two villas in Villa Ganesha compound. We shared the pool and living area with another couple for two nights then had the complex to ourselves for the remainder. Made and his helpers keep the pool, common living area and the pleasant Villas super clean. There is no sea view from the Villas, only from the dining area and lawn area under the palm trees adjacent to the beach. Dining is very pleasant next to the sound of the waves. The food is fresh and simply prepared. The main attraction at the Villas is the walk in snorkelling. However the ocean was fairly turbulent  and muddy for some of our stay so we enjoyed our villa's 10 metre pool instead. There are a variety of excursions offered as other than diving, snorkelling, fishing there is nothing much to see/do in the vicinity. 
If you are looking for a small, quiet, pleasant, relaxing resort for family or couple and don't mind the distance to get there then this is the place.
title: Quiet seaside haven

text: We stayed for 11 nights and it was brilliant.  On arrival Budy welcomed us with chilled refreshing facetowels and a complimentary drink then showed us to our very spacious villa,  huge extremely comfy bed, great ensuite bathroom.  Outside the Villa is a large shared garden courtyard space (with 1 other adjoining villa) with a lovely pool, sun loungers and open air living room to chill out in.  Having a swim before breakfast or last thing under the stars is total bliss.  The restaurant food is especially tasty.  We had dinner here everynight, a range of authentic balinese dishes and beyond,  the food is all freshly prepared,  locally sourced where poss and tastes truly divine.  Breakfast is very good also.  The beach is black sand and pebbles which appears then disappears with the tides so there are sun loungers on a terraced area overlooking the sea,  underneath the palm trees... perfect! We snorkled 2-3 times a day and in the corals saw a turtle,  plenty of tropical fish and a pod of dolphins.   Wayan and Budy helped us decide on a few trips,  git git waterfall,  feeding monkeys, Pura Ulun Danu Temple on Lake Bratan one day, snorkelling the nearby USAT Liberty wreck at Tulamben, tip - leave after breakfast around 9am to get there before the crowds!  Rice fields,  Tirtagangga water palace on another day,  and a 2 hour trip to the local Yeh Mempeh waterfall.  All wonderful and a nice break from completely relaxing!  All the staff are very friendly and helpful and made our stay here special. The Villas Tejakula might seem a bit remote but if you want a laid back, completely chilled out, no stress holiday... it's perfect!
title: A wonderful relaxing experience

owner_response.text:
Dear simonjm_59,
Thank you both for choosing to come to Bali's North Coast and stay with us at The Villas Tejakula.   You both embraced the opportunity to be in a part of Bali where you could relax, unwind and be a part of a small village.   I have read your wonderful review to all of the staff and they were so happy that you have acknowledged the effort that they make to ensure that all guests have a wonderful holiday with us and they look forward to your returning to stay with us again in the future, as so many of guests do.
Once again thank you from myself, Budi and all of our staff here at The VillasTejakula.
Sampai Jumpa Lagi.
Best wishes
Wayan Parniti
Manager
The Villas Tejakula.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: The Villas Tejakula is located in a remote location on the north-eastern part of Bali.  The drive there through the mountains with views of the volcanoes is absolutely mesmerizing.  The property itself is secluded and very relaxing.  The entire property is comprised of villas accommodating a maximum occupancy of 16 for the entire property.  Our villa shared a common pool and living room with another however we felt completely secluded and relaxed.  The restaurant on property is very good and will serve all of your needs while visiting.  Everyone is very accommodating and there is no better place to go to if you want to get off the grid and relax.  No TV's on property either.
title: Amazing secluded beachfront villas

text:
courtious staff, great view of sunrise, good place to do nothing and relax 
however many visitors were doing snorkeling and diving. the couple managing the place have an interesting story to share. ******
title: value for money-good place

text: The rooms are gorgeous.  That is the villas are gorgeous. Each villa consists of two LARGE bedrooms, a shared open air living area with stove, kettle and stocked honor system fridge (beer, wine, soda). Every room looks like it could be out of Architectural Digest, Bali.   The grounds look like a movie set of what a tropical paradise should look like.  In short, the setting, the rooms are with the price of admission.  The icing on the cake, the friendliest most accommodating you will ever likely encounter. Wayan, Budi, Weta, Made, Gede all make life at the Villas an effortless joy.   The food here is superb.  I highly recommend the fish dishes. In every case, the seafood is freshly caught and perfectly prepared.  You will eat Oceanside, under Palm trees, with the moon reflecting on the Bali Sea. You can snorkel directly in front of the Villas (equipment available from the Villas).  To sum up, if you book a stay here, the only regret you will have is that you didn't stay longer.
title: One of the best resorts you will ever visit

text: We recently stayed at The Villas Tejakula.It is sensational.Budi and Wayan make you feel like your part of the family and nothing is too much trouble for them.Villas are magnificently set up plus the restaurant and the food is excellent. We will bring friends and family back to this piece of heaven.
title: Heaven in Bali

text: Buti and Wayan offer a small, intimate resort with excellent facilities and a lovely restaurant on the beach, but the standout feature is the personalised and friendly service from Buti, Wayan and all of their staff, and their attention to detail to make your stay pleasant, relaxing and memorable.
title: A beautiful, quiet and friendly resort that spoils your mind and body.

text: Oh yes. Returned back to the Villas. Spend there 8 nights, just me & my husband. I warmly recommend you to pay some extra to have the whole villa in your use. Wayan, Budi & the team has an excellent service attitude. What ever you need, they will do everything to help you. Food is either good or super good. The list consists both western and balinese portions, you won't be hungry :-). If you want to dive into a paradise with no worries, not too many activities, just relax in peace in beautiful surroundings, this is your place.
title: Second visit to the Villas - great place for relaxation!

text:
We first stayed at Villas Tejakula in 2015. We vowed to come back.......and we did with two other couples who endured our rants....."so relaxing, you become part of the family ...so relaxing, , magnificent coral 50m away - wow!....dolphins cruise at sunrise...the quality of the suites with attention to detail....the freshness of the food ...its so relaxing...tour to Singaraja...the massages....etc etc." Our guests were not disappointed. 
Thank You Wayan and Budi - you did not let us down! 
They loved it - and they too will be back!!
L & S Feb 2017
title: A quiet Oasis in Paradise

text:
I have just spent a wonderful 5 night stay at The Villas Tejakula. The genuine hospitality of all the staff at the villas; the fresh flavours of the tasty Balinese food that we ate for breakfast, lunch and dinner was a highlight. Tejakula is a beautiful, quiet area that reminds me of the Bali I first fell in love with 30 years ago. We did a sunrise boat trip and saw numerous pods of dolphins swimming beside our boat and leaping from the water very close to us...an amazing experience.
The villas are of a very high standard in their presentation, comfort and cleanliness. Our very own swimming pool in our villa compound was fabulous. Highly recommended if you want to have a relaxing break in a beautiful and quiet region of Bali. 
Thank you Wayan, Boudie and all the staff for a gorgeous holiday.
title: Beautiful Villas

text: based on my other hotel experiences in Bali I believe this place is overrated, service and restaurant not as good as any of the other hotels, one slice of breakfast toast and fruit juice in a small wine glass, noisy due to staff parking right in front of room. not worth the money by far.
title: overrated

owner_response.text:
Management responses are published within 24-48 hours after they are submitted. Responses must meet TripAdvisor's Management Response Guidelines.
wayan p, Manager at The Villas Tejakula, responded to this review
Dear Jessica, 
We were very sorry to read your review and my staff were very upset. 
When you requested a room change (due to very happy guests celebrating in the next Villa) we were very prompt to accommodate you and this gave you the added advantage of having a 2 Bedroom Villa to yourself rather than sharing with another couple as is normally the case with a Deluxe King Room. 
I spoke to you at Breakfast and I am aware that our service was slow that morning as everyone seemed to arrive at same time. Your Banana smoothie was also late as the fruit we had taken delivery of that morning was not satisfactory and we sent someone to buy more locally. I do apologise for this delay but I am surprised that you were unhappy with how it was served – it was in a standard wine glass (not a small one) and we have never had a complaint about the quantity before. It is only the smoothie which is served in this glass and the freshly made fruit juice comes in a different glass. 
For Breakfast, we offer our guests fresh fruit with homemade yoghurt or muesli fruit and yoghurt, with your choice of a freshly made fruit juice (not from a box) or a smoothie. 
You then have a choice of eggs, tomato & bacon (and baked beans) which you can choose to have with or without toast. You are also able to have more toast with your tea or coffee and most of our jams are home made as well. In addition to this we also offer you a Banana Pancake and even more toast, tea or coffee upon request– so we have found that rather than complain about the quantity many guests say that it does not leave them any room for lunch. If you wished to have more toast you only had to ask.
The motor scooters that you mention are a part of life in Bali and are everywhere, but the scooters you had heard would have been gone very quickly as this is not a through road and the traffic is minimal.
What a shame that you arrived at 4.00 p.m. one day and then left by noon the next day as I am sure that had you booked to stayed longer you would have begun to enjoy the truly unique experience that we offer. 
As we had acted very promptly to your complaint re the noisy guests less than one hour after your arrival, I do wish you had spoken to me about your other concerns rather than in the public arena. 
I assure you that the comfort, happiness and wellbeing of our guests is of paramount importance to us and I think that our reviews are a testament to this. We have a wonderful team of staff who always do their very best to take care of our guests and have had their efforts rewarded with the wonderful reviews that we have received to date. I do not know of the other places you stayed in Bali as you only reviewed our Hotel but once again the majority of our guests are highly complimentary of every aspect of our business.
Wayan Parniti, Manager
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text: I really enjoyed this quiet tropical paradise in north of Bali. If you want to escape busy and overcrowded south, then this is perfect place where to hide. Hotel is very modern and villas are very very nice and have everything you need. 2 villas share 1 swimming pool and kitchen, swimming pool is quite large and kitchen has everything what you need. Breakfast are very tasty and overall food quality is exceptional, I highly recommend burger from restaurant menu.
title: Great place to relax

text: Have had a wonderful time at the villas Tejakula. It is so peaceful and the food is amazing. Budi and Wayan and all their staff are so helpful and have organised our airport pickups, day trips ,massages and answered all our questions. you can be as busy seeing the best Bali has to offer then return to  the beautiful villas to relax and enjoy the peace and quiet right on the ocean.🌸
title: Perfect holiday

text: In summary great food and great service in a remote location that provides security, serenity and privacy. Activities include massages for $25.00,ocean fishing, scooter hire,swimming in private secluded swimming pools,dolphin watching, waterfall walks,scuba diving,and just relaxing. Food was excellent in variety and quality. Managers, owners and staff were all were very warm and friendly. They could not do enough for their guests and were more like old friends by the time we left. The two bedroom Villas  are best suited for  families with 2 adults and 2 young adults over ten (because the pool lacks safety fencing) or two couples who are friends, as the living area is a shared space. Each bedroom has its own ensuite and is air conditioned. A great Holiday choice if you are looking for a quiet location away from the city's nightlife and bustle. It is on Bali's north coast nearly 3 hour's drive from Kuta. We had a great holiday.
title: One of Bali's best kept secrets-a tropical paradise!

text:
We stayed in January as two couples which is the ideal booking as you get the two-bedroom villa & pool all to yourself. There are 4 two-bedroom villas on the property, each with a shared living area & pool so if you are just renting one of the bedrooms be prepared to share the living space & pool with another couple. 

The rooms are large & spacious with great air conditioning. The bathrooms are also beautiful. The shared living area contains couches, tables, a kitchen area and a CD player. This all overlooks the pool. 

The staff are all lovely & do their job well. The chef is amazing, creating beautiful dishes & different specials daily. The wait staff know your name & are attentive. The managers are efficient & friendly. They are so easy to get along with & so obliging to help organise tours (we went scuba diving, fishing & to the waterfall). The spa is very relaxing & the massages are top quality!! 

Cannot say enough about this place, we loved our 6 nights here & will be back!! 

Be aware it is quite far from the airport, about 3hrs drive but very scenic! Don't forget travel medication if you are prone to car sickness.
title: Lovely place!!

text:
The reason we chose to book 6 nights here was because of the fantastic reviews on TripAdvisor. Naturally then, we had high expectations when we arrived. I'm very happy to say that our expectations were met and exceeded. From the great transport to the Villas over the mountains, to the warm welcome and treatment during our stay, we all loved our visit! The Villas are beautiful inside and out and are located about 50m or so from the shore and the restaurant which serves the most delicious food. The prices are very reasonable and are of a very high standard. Western and Balinese dishes are available and both types are delicious. Their beef tenderloins are imported from high quality Australian beef and are cooked to perfection and the fish is freshly sourced. We took the Villa boat out with Made and caught two fish that were cooked up and served for dinner. 
There is a great waterfall, snorkelling and diving nearby among other attractions. The Spa is very good and massages very nice.
The Villas themselves are very well appointed and luxurious. The pool, shared with the other room making up the two-bedroom villa, is very clean and modern as are the Villas themselves. It is gorgeous to gaze out over at night from the outdoor kitchen / shared living area with all of the pool and garden lights on. That brings me to the meticulously landscaped gardens that are maintained by a dedicated and hardworking gardener that takes care of the whole property. It truely adds to the calming effect that Wayan and Budi (the mangers) strive so hard to provide. They simply could not do enough to ensure that our stay was hassle free and one to remember. All of the staff are very helpful, friendly and very happy to lend a hand or teach guests a little bit of the Balinese language and culture. The Villas Tejakula are located around 3hrs from Denpasar via a picturesque scenic van ride through the mountains. The staff are very happy to stop along the way to let guest have a look at landmarks and take pictures. The Villas are most suited to couples holidaying together. This is so that they can take advantage of booking one whole 2 bedroom villa and having a pool to themselves and not having to share one. They are still great for couples on their own as long as they don't mind sharing a pool and outdoor living space together.
Thanks again Wayan, Budi and staff for a wonderful stay - We will be back as soon as we can!
title: An amazing stay with wonderful people!

text: My family - 2 adults and 2 boys aged 14 and 10years had 5 lovely nights at The Villas Tejakula in January.  The villas were beautifully appointed and very luxurious - lovely to have our own private pool and tranquility.  Bodi and Wayan are extremely good hosts and lovely people - all of the team at The Villas were very attentive and looked after us all, accommodating our every need.  We chartered their little boat one day and had a beautiful morning snorkelling in the clear waters - lots of coloured fish and sea stars.  Had a great walk to the waterfall and invigorating swim underneath.  The dive school next door had unfortunately closed for the season so we weren't able to dive.  Also possibly not a great amount to do for younger kids - my 10 year old went a little stir crazy by the end.  Perfect for adults wanting some R & R though.
title: Serenity in a beautiful oasis

text:
Lovely, lovely place. Quiet secluded. 
Spectacular two bedroom suite with own pool and large outdoor living area. 
Well trained staff and the nicest hostess. 
Highly recommended for a quiet retreat. 
Peter, Canada
title: January stay at the Villas, Tejakula

text:
This was our third trip to Bali and my wife and I decided we wanted to try some 
un-touristy, out of the way places for a change. Some life events over the past 6 months had made us want to have a vacation that was more on the quiet, relaxing side - but in a beautiful setting. We also really enjoy snorkeling and it's those characteristics that drew us to the Villas Tejakula. It was a fairly quick one hour drive from our previous stop in Amed, and about a 3 hour drive back to the airport. No big deal when you have a safe driver and are taking in the beautiful views of Bali. Arriving at the Villas was breathtaking! We lucked out and had our villa to ourselves. Everything about the accommodations, villa, pool, staff, grounds etc. was TOP NOTCH! Having the a great little snorkeling reef right off the back shore was a real treat - you could just go in anytime and enjoy the underwater life. We even saw a reef octopus!! Breakfast was included and was very good, although the limited choices became redundant after two days for us. Being so remote, we had read ahead of time that the restaurant on site was the best place in the area to eat - and we were not disappointed. We never felt the desire to even research another place to go and eat. Our lunches and dinners were all amazing and very fairly priced in our opinion. The menu was fairly small, but had enough variety for our 4 days stay there. As well, special requests were always very enthusiastically received and taken care of with a smile. A must try is the whole tuna cooked in banana leaf - amazing! We were only the 2 of us and had a fair amount of tuna leftover and the staff offered to keep it for us to have for lunch the next day. Mixed with a salad, it was perfect. Speaking of the salad - I loved it - ordered it almost every day! Thank you to all the staff who made our stay here a wonderful, unforgettable experience from start to finish: Gede, Made, Weda, Budi, Wayan and everyone we encountered. You guys have a great thing going at Villas Tejakula - keep it up!!
title: Little oasis in Northern Bali

photos.caption: Wayan and Budi on our last day...:(
Looking over the water contemplating where we will go snorkeling
Where you can sit at night and watch the fishing boats in the horizon
Shared area if both villas are occupied, if not you have this all to yourself!

text: Although Tejakula is about 4 hours driving from the airport (because of traffic), it's worth every minute when you arrive at the Villas Tejakula. We arrived after midnight but still received a warm welcome from the friendly staff. Once you see your villa with the stunning bathroom and beautiful bedroom, you know how heaven looks like. Every villa has an open shared living room and an amazing private pool. All the staff is very helpful and do everything they can to make you feel welcome. They have a nice little spa and beautiful natural garden with seaview. The restaurant is simple but excellent food, breakfast delicious with fresh fruit and juice, omelets and lovely banana pancakes. Wayan and Budi are very friendly managers and are willing to arrange anything for you. We are definitely coming back.....
title: The place in North Bali where dreams come through!

text:
The Villas Tejakula are remarkable. The land is owned by a Balinese family and Budi and Wayan are truly gracious and welcoming hosts. 

Their partner and his family spend much of their time there. They've built this place to be their home and you'll enjoy all the comforts they've so thoughtfully chosen to live with. 

This is an authentic Bali ocean experience. It is quiet. The ocean is beautiful.  There is an amazingly biodiverse reef just seventy feet from shore to snorkel. 

The food is delicious and my dietary choices were graciously accommodated and elegantly executed. We ate every meal there for a few days and we were always satisfied and delighted by every new thing we tried. 

It's quiet. Expect to entertain yourself with a book or conversation with a dear friend. There are fabulous day trips to go to, but we enjoyed the peace and tranquility. 

They helped us hang our aerial silks rig from a coconut tree on the deck. Your requests might not be so exotic but know that they'll be met thoughtfully.

We enjoyed The Villas Tejakula so much that we've decided to spend our last days in Bali at their sister villa in Ubud. 

We like these people and we're grateful for how at home they made us feel. 

A good price for a great stay in Bali.
title: Seaside Tranquility

text:
My partner and I spent 4 days here over Christmas 2016. We could not rave about The Villas Tejakula more! Starting from their fantastic transfer service (competitive pricing made it worth it), to the incredibly kind staff. Every single member of staff treated us like family. They were friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern, yet not overdone, creating a peaceful environment. Also the whole resort is very clean. The pool to each room is just perfect, nice and cool and a good depth. Each villa shares the perfect space to relax with a book and the beautiful location really just tops it all off. The spa is well worth it, and not overpriced like most resort in-house spas. Now for the best bit - the FOOD! We had 4 days so plenty of time to try a lot on the menu and it was all phenomenal. 
We were up north to do some Scuba Diving and the dive centre right next door, was also great. It meant we could relax in the most comfort, have the best food, and get the diving in that we love. 
Thank you Wayan & Budi for such a great experience, we loved feeling a part of the Family. Dean & Robin, thank you for creating such an outstanding place to relax. Its perfect.
title: Best of Northern Bali

text: The villas are really nice. Everything is perfect. The owners are really kind and try to make your stay as perfect as it can. There are many activities to do there. The warung (restaurant) is so delicious! you can eat near the sea and eat fresh fish everyday! The rooms are really big, clean and new.
title: peacefull and really nice stay

text:
This place is definitely not for those seeking for bustle and nightlife on Bali. But if you want to spend days in tropical paradise, consider Villas Tejakula. It is a secluded and quiet property located right on the waterfront. The guest houses are spacious, very cosy and perfectly well groomed. You are given a private territory with a swimming pool, garden and lounge.
If you like swimming and snorkelling, the beautiful home reef is only 20-30 meters into the sea, abundant in corals, fish, and other wonders. Have a beer at the beachfront restaurant and plunge into waves, or do it vice versa.
And of course I would like to say many thanks to Wayan - lady of the house - and other people helping her with keeping the place. You can't find more attentive and caring hosts.
All in all I highly recommend The Villas Tejakula.
title: The nook of tranquillity

text: We had a comfortable stay at this place in the month of June. The people and the facilities provided are very good and nice. Being on the beach brings added advantage to the place and the hospitality is very warm and good. Looking forward to be back here soon
title: Good Place to stay

text: This is a small hotel in an idyllic beachfront location with a backdrop of mist topped mountains. I am writing this sat in the shade of a palm tree whilst listening to the waves lapping. It really does not get much better than this. The management Wayan & Budy are absolutely lovely and go out of their way to ensure everything is perfect. All the staff are superb and the food is absolutely delicious. I can recommend the ribs and barbecued whole tuna. The rooms are spacious and very clean with crisp bed linen and an excellent bathroom. The place feels newly built or refurbished. Each two bedroom villa shares a private pool with the adjoining villa and as we stayed as two couples it was very private. The area is secluded and very quiet which is exactly what we wanted. The local temple is very close and we were invited to one of the ceremonies which was an unforgettable experience.
