Oh and the snorkelling off the hotels private coral reef is great too. I would recommend this place without hesitation to anybody wanting to "get away" from things for a few days in total luxury

user_location.name: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, Inggris Raya

title: Simply Perfect

text: Back for a third time, this time bringing my parents for a well-needed and deserved break. I've stayed at this immaculate slice of heaven since it opened and you can't help but dream of your next stay on your departure. The Villas Tejakula has expanded since my last visit in April 2016, there is now water-side dining and a bar with cocktails. Such wonderful new additions demonstrate that feedback and comments are listened to and are actioned. The staff are there to assist you with absolutely any question or inquiry. The massages were relaxing; the food perfection; the snorkelling amazing; and the villas - your own private oasis. This is my favourite place to stay in the world. It will be yours too.
title: Third time is a charm

text: No photos or videos can do this place justice. It is luxurious in every aspect. Each villa is expansive, including the bathroom. Full privacy is assured. The staff here are amazing - so warm, friendly, welcoming and helpful. I came to relax and unwind from the grind of daily life and work. That relaxation began the moment we arrived. There are activities to do here such as day tours, snorkelling and riding scooters. However, if all you want to do is relax you are guaranteed that will happen. I have had a couple of massages and a scooter ride to Amed. There are nearby local markets to visit and a waterfall to see as well.
title: Paradise Luxury

text: We chose The Villas Tejakula because of TripAdvisor recommendations. I do recommend for you to do the same. All the stories & pictures here tell our experience. Spend a week in The Villas in Oct-Nov w our family (4 adults). Beautiful villa, very well taken care of, clean, cozy & well planned. Wayan & Budi and their excellent personnel took so good care of us. My husband's special diet was organized even we didn't ask them to do that. What ever was needed, it was arranged. We made some small tours around - whenever we wanted to, wherever we wanted to. Ate almost all the meals in the Villas, and enjoyed. The food was very good. Blue sea stars & and a natural aquarium in 20 meters from the coastline. Relaxing and healing massage when listening to waves. Go there. You will be spoiled.
title: Serenity, peace & beauty

text:
We booked The Villas Tejakula last minute (searching internet, making a phone call, arriving 15 mins later ;) and hence the whole family was wondering how our adventure is going to turn out. It was great! 

Beachfront Warung Kelapa restaurant with freshly made food and super attentive staff, comfortable yet very stylish accommodation in 2-bedroom villa with private pool, snorkeling on a beautiful reef just in front of the resort. Managers, lovely Wayan and Budi were always there, ready to address any needs, make us feel very welcome and share wonderful insight about Balinese culture. Kids could freely roam around and explore.

Highly recommended! Also, we have done a trip to nearby The Les Waterfall, short drive by car followed by 20 minutes walk through the jungle ended under the ice cold waterfall where one could get a 'gentle' massage by falling streams of water. More trips around possible or just relax in the villa and read books.
title: Beautiful place, brilliant people and stunning nature all around

text:
In the north part of Bali we spent 4 magnificent days at Villas Tejakula.
WOW, on arrival we were welcomed by Boddi and Wayan and their friendly staff, to be shown our luxurious Villas with large private pool and lounging areas, each Villa has 2 bedrooms.
We spent many meals in their restaurant by the waters edge sipping on cocktails and wine.
We snorkelled on the reef straight out in front followed up by body massages, facials and morning Yoga.
title: Heaven on Earth in Bali

text:
We stayed at the Villas Tejakula for four nights, and our experience was PERFECT. 

The villas are absolutely flawless. They thought of everything. The bathrooms are beautiful and well equipped. Same with the kitchen. Everything was impeccably clean. So many small details were thought of -- even the disc drive with endless relaxing music.  The honest bar is perfect. The pool was so so so amazing. We spent one whole day just lying around reading poolside. They even provide pool noodles.

The restaurant is delicious. Their chef is phenomenal. The wait staff is so so sweet. We kept trying to tip our waitress but she wouldn't accept a tip (even though we know this may be a cultural norm we had a hard time with it -- everyone else in Bali accepted our tips and the wait staff at the Villas Tejakula seemed like they weren't aloud to take a tip). But we really wanted to tip our server because she was so great. I hope she gets a bonus. We forget her name, but she was thin with a young baby (about 15 months). She was so wonderful. 

Our only criticism that the villas are advertised as "private" (we rented both bedrooms -- each villa has two), but the staff comes in at minimum three times a day. Once at night to lower the blinds (we requested to have this not done because we woke up twice very very early (1:30 am and 4am) for excursions and I was nearly sleep walking and walked right into them). They come in again to clean the pool and a third time in the morning to raise the blinds. Also, the manager came in with a few guys to check something with the power. Had we been sunbathing topless or something that would've been a bit uncomfortable. Once I was in the kitchen grabbing a drink and I turn around and someone was tending to the plants - no warning at all. The privacy thing is my only complaint, but everything else was absolutely wonderful. We would highly suggest the Villas leaving a "do not disturb" door knob sign for the guests to use on the main villa gate.

The location: Tejakula is less touristy than Seminyak and Ubud, which makes it a wonderful getaway from all the hustle and bustle. Wayan and her husband are wonderful hosts. Wayan communicated very well in helping us setup our excursions and activities. During our time there we coordinated the following through her:

1. Dolphin boat tour -- a sunrise tour on a Balinese boat... We actually saw Dolphins! It was fun. Driver included too. 
2. Fishing tour - Wayan coordinated a couple hour fishing tour on a traditional Balinese boat -- we ended up spending most of it chasing a group of whales. It was incredible. There was even a baby whale. Our captain didn't speak English well, but we didn't mind at all. He was so nice and did everything to keep up with the whales. Even after the whales left the area we caught a fish!!! 
3. Mt. Batur climb - our favorite part of the whole trip! Left at 1:30 am and returned around 11am. Wayan's driver is awesome and very nice, and the climber guide was excellent. It was a private guide, so we weren't lumped in with some big group. We didn't have to take breaks and he showed us the back side of the mountain, which had hardly any tourists. Then our driver took us to a great restaurant that had an amazing view of Mt. Batur. 

Overall I would HIGHLY recommend the Villas Tejakula. During our time in Bali we also stayed at a 5-star resort in Nusa Dua, and the Villas Tejakula was nicer than that resort. If the remote location is stopping you from staying, don't let it! Tejakula is wonderful and you can easily access many activities with Wayan's help.
title: HEAVEN ON EARTH!

text: We have just spent 4 wonderful nights at Villas Tejakula with a group of friends - 4 of our friends visited the Villas last year and enjoyed it so much they arranged a group of 10 of us to visit in Sept 16. From the moment we arrived, Wayan was warm, friendly and welcoming. Wayan and Budi manage the Villas and are a wealth of information and very hospitable, as are all the staff. The Villas themselves are 2 big bedrooms with a common area that has a couple of lounges, coffee table, dining table and kitchen facilities in the middle with nice touches such as playing cards and books. Each villa has a beautiful pool to enjoy. Each day staff tidied the bedrooms and common areas while we enjoyed breakfast under the palm trees right in front of the sea where we snorkelled! Food is good with a variety of Indonesian and western style meals, the spring rolls are particularly good. We had massages and facials in the spa hut which were great! Budi took us to a waterfall one day and was very informative on our walk about the different plants along the path. We also went out on the Villas Tejakula's traditional boat for a look up and down the coast. A great place if you are looking to relax and rejuvenate. We will definitely be back!
title: 4 fantastic nights!

text:
After having not visited Bali for over 30 years what a wonderful introduction back.....the accomodation was faultless, very comfortable, luxurious villas with lovely private pool.
Wayan and Boudi and all the staff delivered fabulous service, all meals were exceptional, very reasonable wine prices too!!! To be able to snorkel right in front of the villas was a remarkable experience being right on the coral reef, very secluded with very few tourists in the area was an easy way back into the Bali I remember.
title: Brilliant accomodation and service in idyllic location

text: Wonderful, large villas, equipped and decorated in a very good style. We felt welcome and pampered by host and staff right after arrival. We had the large pool for ourselves, great. Tasty and fresh food, served directly at the Java sea. A great place to stay, which we will visit again.
title: There are a few places on earth you should not miss

text: We stayed in the Villas with our 3 teenage children during a week in Aug 2016. This time was really wonderful. Both Budi and Wayan (the couple who owns the villas) were very helpful and it was a pleasure to speak with them every day and share experiences. They made us feel at home and did the utmost to show us their country and way of living. The villas are of a very high standard with an eye for detailed luxury. We had a private pool which was perfectly clean and maintained. The whole staff is involved, very polite and friendly. Each member of the staff and cleaning personnel gives you the feeling that you're more than just a tourist. We will definitely go back to enjoy the food at the seaside.
title: A little undiscovered piece of paradise

text: This little hotel is definitely worth the trip. The most amazing Villas with private pools and an amazing restaurant with sea view. To top it all off the team is lovely and welcoming making you feel right at home. A great place to get away from the buzz of city life and relax in a beautiful and calm surrounding.
title: Amazing little hotel!

text:
The villas are just beautiful! The location at the sea, the bathroom, the room it self, the swimming pool to share with your neighbors if you don't rent the whole villa, everything was great!
The breakfast was delicious, so was the other food. 
The only down side for us was that our neighbors turned out to be the owners of the place. They moved in a day later and my son kindly said to the woman that we had put some drinks in our shared fridge and that they were no part of the honesty bar. She replied in a very unfriendly way
 'I know how it works, I own the place'! 
We first thought we must have misunderstood, because if you own the place why would you speak in such an unfriendly way to one of your customers. But later the man came to us and told us the same, in a normal way though. 
Other then this I would recommend the villas, and the couple that run the place, because obviously the owners just invested, are great.
title: Beautiful

text:
If you are looking for a holiday location that promises total relaxation in a peaceful tropical garden setting on Bali's North Eastern Coast, then The Villas Tejakula are ideal.
Perfect for discerning single or travelling couples each villa ensures privacy whilst clever design provides for some shared facilities.
We loved the privacy of the pool; the genuine, warm hospitality of the staff and the serenity of the location. 
The facilities are outstanding as is the food from the restaurant.
To wake for an early morning visit to the local market is a difficult ask; but is an unforgettable experience- it is an absolute must !
Our four nights at The Villas Tejakula were the highlight of our three weeks in Bali.
title: Tropical tranquility at Tejakula

text:
We had a wonderful 4 days stay at Villa Tejakula. The villa itself is luxourous and excellent for a family or friends looking for a relaxing time by the private pool and the nice garden. The staff is very friendly, and the hospitality by Wayan and Boody is unique.
We were very pleased with local trip to Les waterfall, dolphin tour at Lovina and hot springs nearby Lovina.
A great view to the sea, however no beach. Shorkeling is likewise dependant on clear water. 
Transportation from airport/Kuta takes time and a stay could be combined with Kintamani tour, Lovina and/or another villa, fx Sanglung as we did.
title: Our best stay on Bali

text: We stayed at the villas tedjakula for 4days and was just blown away by the peace of heaven we had found the people staff and guests are always welcoming happy smiling friendly and just a whole lot more the attention to detail and all the little things just make this place amazing we have never had food this awesome a very BIG thank you to wayan and budi xxxx
title: WOW a touch of paradise

text: My wife and I went to Bali and stayed at 9 locations across 10 nights, with the stays ranging from $31 to $224 a night. The Villas was our favorite location, as it was the most well maintained, well thought out placed we stayed at. This was the only location that looked just as good as the photos and wasn't misleading. The lounge was great, clean, very spacious with relaxing music and cards. The room was large, and very clean. The location had easy access to the water, and a restaurant with amazing spring rolls. They provide scooters for you to rent, which we took to danu batur and to other areas nearby. Both owners were great to talk to, friendly, and wanted to address any concerns you may have. I don't see what else you could want, and it was one of the highlights of our trip.
title: Best Stay on the Island

text: We were looking for a place along the North side of Bali to be closer to Mount Batur for trekking.  We read all the positive reviews here on Trip Advisor, so we booked 3 days.  Wow, everybody was right and then some.  Wayan and Budi were perfect hosts along with all the excellent staff.  Once we arrived, Wayan was waiting for us to show us around our villa and the grounds.  There are 4 separate villas with 2 rooms in each one.  We were lucky to be there when only 1 other couple was there, so we have a whole villa to ourselves.  No need to share multiple additional pictures, as the ones in here and in other reviews show off the place very well.  The rooms were well appointed with all the little things one notices in well kept establishments.  I loved the rain shower in the bath!!  The pool was perfect sized for lounging in and temperature was just a perfect contrast to the heat outside.  There are a couple sitting areas in the villa, both shaded and in the sun, depending on what you are wanting.  Honest bar, mosquito repellent, and bottled water dispenser are just a few extras that made you feel at home.  The massages were great, as we had them each of the 3 days we were there.  Food was terrific and location next to the beach for romantic outdoor dinners was something we will remember forever.  Even though we don't travel to Bali all the time, we will definitely have this on our list to spend even longer at next time.  Don't hesitate to book, just do it.  You won't be let down, but probably, will have your expectations met and then some.  To Wayan and Budi and all the staff, thanks again for sharing your oasis with us.  We will never forget our time here!!
title: Perfect Place in Bali

photos.caption: View fom front room in Villa to the back
View from back of Villa looking towards to Bali Sea

text: Everything about The Villas Tejakula is perfect, from the immaculate, spotless villa and the enchanting gardens. The spacious villas combine contemporary and traditional Balinese design perfectly to create a tranquil and relaxing atmosphere. We loved the little extras such as umbrellas, sarongs, bite repellent, and honesty bar.  Combined with a fantastic massage, delicious food and charming,gracious staff, we had a wonderful 5 nights. It truly is a little gem!
title: A Little Gem!

text: My husband and I stayed at The Villas Tejakula for three wonderful days. From booking to leaving, Budi and Wayan were responsive, hospitable, and professional. The staff paid attention to every detail and were kind and courteous.  Transportation was easy to schedule, meals were delicious and cheap, and the villa was outstanding! The villas and surrounding area are beautiful. None of the pictures do it any justice. I highly recommend staying here!
title: Great Villas!

text:
The villas concept is great: the privacy of a holiday villa combined with the services and amenities of a hotel. Wayan is great, making everyone feel right at home and very wellcome! If you want to chill or snorkel or dive, or explore, you will be taking care of. 

Only slight downside are the ubiquous roasters waking you up early, earplugs or not.... that's Bali....
title: Outstanding, stylish, relaxed, excellent hosts!

text: I don't normally write reviews, but this is a worthwhile exception. We spent 5 blissful days at the The Villas Tejakula, a truly incredible experience.  The Villas are magnificent and the service was impeccable we felt pampered everyday.  Can not wait to go back.
title: A little bit of paradise on eath

text: What an incredible experience my husband and I had here on our honeymoon! The staff were amazing, Wayan and her husband were very attentive and the place is absolutely beautiful down to the last detail. I was sick the first night and Wayan and her husband were so caring and concerned and found me a doctor who was excellent. The food was amazing. We also had a couples massage- the sounds of the waves hitting the coast made it heavenly. Because the other room in our villa was vacant, we had the whole pool area and kitchen to ourselves. Highly recommended if you'd like a romantic, luxurious, and tranquil escape!
title: Beautiful and Luxurious

text:
It is rarely that one comes across such a beautiful resort paired with an impeccable service. I and my friend spent 5 nights at the villas and the experience was amazing! The villas are very well designed, comfortable and quite private guaranteeing fantastically relaxing experience. The staff at the resort are very friendly and helpful going out of their way to make our stay comfortable.
We also bought some tours from the resort, a yoga class, massage and mani/pedi. We enjoyed all of them. The best thing was that the tours were quite flexible and could accommodate our preferences easily.   I will definitely go back!
title: Paradise on earth!

text:
My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in early May 2015.  We could not have been more pleased with the resort, the staff, and the rooms.  We had a one bedroom.  They have one bedrooms that share a small pool, and the other room was empty so we had our own villa.  Wayan, the manager, was super attentive and we always felt pampered. 

The rooms were spectacular and the privacy of the villas we unique.  Great value for the money and I would recommend to anyone wanting to get away.
title: Amazing and definite 5 star getaway

text:
Stayed here for 1 night only (unfortunately) but thoroughly enjoyed the stop-over. We had exclusive use of an enormous 2-bedroom Villa with its own pool. It was completely self-contained and utterly private. The restaurant was situated near the beach in a beautiful location with a great view. We went snorkeling on the nearby reef and there's a diving school next door for those interested.

We wanted fish for dinner but were, very honestly, told that they only had freshly frozen fish. We thought this was perfectly ok. However a few hours later we were offered 2 freshly caught fish (wahoo, we think) that were deliciously barbecued for us later that evening. Full points for that one, guys.

The place was extremely well maintained, the gardens and surrounds pristine and beautiful. The one BIG thing I noticed is that the Villas, the restaurant and the kitchen were not just spotlessly clean - they were METICULOUSLY clean. They clearly put a lot of work and effort into the place and it is worth a visit, and a longer stay, if you're in the area.

Another win for us. Good value, superior accommodation, great service, relaxed and enjoyable.
title: A Great find

text: This place has to be experienced to be believed- so much more magic than the photos! Snorkeling, boating with the Dolphins, dining at the amazing restaurant and our heavenly villa made leaving here so, so hard. One of the places you would tell the world about and work to get back to as often as you can. Staff were just wonderful which made the whole experience even more wonderful.
title: Paradise!

text:
Bali is a beautiful island, & this has to be one of the very best places to stay ! If you're looking for quality, attention to detail, in a quiet & unspoilt location, then I challenge you to get better than The Villas Tejakula !
I was lucky enough to have 5 nights here & I can honestly say I cannot find a single negative to say about The Villas - a very rare thing !
From booking directly with Wayan ( who I had many friendly & informative emails as I was travelling from England ), to departing for my second destination in Ubud, the whole process went seamlessly ! As a 62 year old woman ( yes used to travelling alone all over the world ), this fact in itself means a great deal. My arrival in Bali was in the late hours, which meant I had to stay in a hotel near the airport. As prearranged, Wayan sent a car & driver to pick me up & I had a very comfortable ride to The Villas, via the route of my choice. The welcome when I arrived was wonderful - like joining the family !
The actual villas are out of this world. I was extremely lucky to have the whole double villa to myself - no sharing the pool, outside area, or kitchen/living area.
What impressed me especially was the attention to detail in everything - the design & layout of the whole place ( small but beautifully formed ), from the pretty gardens, walkways, seating areas, to the night time lighting. Everything was so well thought out & immaculately kept !
Here are some examples of the finer points of attention to detail at The Villas -
Daily filled water jug & glasses in the bedroom ( also bottled water )
Boxes of tissues everywhere ( when I arrived it was with a heavy cold & what a blessing they were )
Super effective a/c, fans ( ceiling & freestanding )
The wifi was amazing wherever I was & so quick
Good quality soaps & shampoo
Cd/iPod player, TV & DVD ( there was soft music playing when I arrived )
Cold glasses kept in the freezer with plenty of ice cubes ready
A large jug of cold water always in the fridge along with the mini bar things
Books to read, playing cards, note books & pens
Candles, mosquito coils, clothing drying rails
Outside shower, large soft towels, comfortable sun beds in & out of the shade
Snorkelling equipment, tailor made trips, massages
The food is fresh & beautifully cooked & presented
I really could go on & on !
All this & I haven't even gotten round to mentioning the staff who are just wonderful - kind, friendly, extremely efficient & honestly make you feel part of their family. To say that they care about you & only want the very best for you, would be an understatement ! They take great pride in giving you the very best experience possible !
To anyone going to The Villas I unreservedly recommend to you !
To everybody at The Villas, I thank you from the bottom of my heart for such a fantastic stay !
title: 5 star plus !

text:
I stayed at The Villas Tejakula for a week towards the end of March and it was wonderful!  The place itself is gorgeous - beautifully presented accommodation (with your own pool if you're lucky enough to get a whole villa to yourself - which we were!) and exquisite gardens.  It is the perfect place for anyone just wanting to relax as there really is nothing to do but to unwind.  

We took advantage of the well priced massages available at the spa and spent a great deal of time swimming in our own pool, snorkelling just out the front of the resort, lazing on the sun-lounges overlooking the ocean and eating at the restaurant, which serves amazing food! Of course, if you want to go on some day trips, there are plenty of excursions available that the very helpful staff will organise for you (we went out on a boat at sunrise to see dolphins, went to a nearby waterfall and did a longer trip (about 90mins drive each way) to a very pretty sandy beach).  

The staff are incredibly friendly and really go out of their way to make sure your stay is perfect.   The managers, Wayan and Budi, treat you as if you're part of their own family - they are just so lovely.  Weda, who works in the restaurant, is so kind that she took us to her temple in another village so we could watch a ceremony, in which it turned out, her uncle was dancing!  She and Wayan helped us get ready by providing traditional Balinese clothes that must be worn in the temple and took us there on the back of their motor scooters.  The next day, Weda picked me up on her scooter again and took me to the early morning food market with her where she does her shopping.  It was a great experience and I saw fruit and vegetables there that I'd never seen before!

Thank you so much Wayan, Budi, Weda, and all the team for one of the most relaxing and friendly holidays I've ever been on.  We will definitely be back.
title: A beautiful and very relaxing place with truly amazing service

text:
The accommodation is clean and stylish. The villas are private with a large bedroom and massive bathroom, a shared kitchen and pool (if there’s someone in the accommodation at the other end of the villa) that is large and airy – overall fabulous. 

Wayan, Budi, Weda and all of the staff made our stay so enjoyable, organising viewing sunrise and dolphins from an outrigger canoe, a waterfall tour, a day at White Sand beach, massages and a visit to the local temple for the full moon celebrations; dressed in traditional clothing.

And when we returned to the villas, there was snorkelling off the reefs that are only 20 metres away and lovely meals in the restaurant where the food was great and beer and wine reasonably priced.

Thoroughly recommend as a different Bali holiday – so relaxing, yet entertaining and enjoyable.
title: The place to go to relax, see the natural Bali and to experience the culture and friendliness of the Balinese people

text:
Looking for a lovely place to relax, be waited on, in a beautiful setting with delicious food?
Then this is your dream holiday.  Villas Tejakula is a beautiful respite in the north eastern part of Bali.  It is a quiet part of the island - exactly what we were looking for!  The villas are exquisitely decorated, comfortable, and spotlessly kept.  The grounds are stunning and staff are attentive, yet not intrusive. We were able to snorkel and dive right off the resort shore.  We did hike to a waterfall and visit a local textile in the village.  But mainly we enjoyed the food (try the BBQ ribs), massages, private pool, and beach of Villas Tejalika.  Resort managers, Wayan and Budy treated us like friends and even invited us to a ceremony at their temple, which we loved.  This was so worth the three hour drive from the airport!  i wouldn't stay anywhere else in Bali! Unless it was at Villa Saraswati, owned by the same couple, Robin and Wayne! ;))
title: Paradise Found!

text:
I was referred to The Villas Tejakula by their owners who happened to also own Villa Saraswati in Ubud. It wasn't as if I had a ticket out of Bali yet, so of course, I extended my stay to check out northern Bali. The ride was all prepared for me and all I had to do was get in the car. So up and down the mountain I went and around the volcano and through some quaint villages. The journey itself was memorable.

But the destination is even more memorable. The shared space consisted of a couple of patio and lounge sets facing the ocean surrounded by coconut trees and beautifully landscaped garden. Do fall asleep here in between rounds of snorkeling just off the coast (all equipment provided by the villa)

I stayed at Villa Ganesha. Honestly, I have never stayed at anywhere so grand, so I may be bias, but this is luxury at its finest. There are actually 2 bedrooms at this villa but as I am solo, I only occupied one. The room is enormous with a pitched, beautifully layered ceiling and a huge comfortable bed. The bathroom area connects to the bedroom and likewise enormous with dual sinks.

There is also a kitchen area with lounging and dining area which I didn't really use because, well, lounging and patio sets by the ocean. 

Let's not forget the private pool. No joke, you can do laps in this pool. I pretty much lived it that pool for 3 days. (when I am not lounging by the ocean)

The managers Wayan and Budi were welcoming and organized all outside excursions (boat rides to see some dolphins and trip to the waterfall). Their staff attentive but not intrusive.

Finally, the spring rolls at the restaurant are amazing. I think I will miss it the most (and I am Asian)
title: Is this a dream?

text:
Upon arriving at this amazing location I was blown away by the stunning accommodation provided by The Villas Tejakula.   Right on the beachfront it was fantastic to have breakfast, lunch and dinner in their restaurant overlooking the beautiful gardens on the oceanfront.    A must do if it is the right time of year is an early morning cruise to see the Dolphins just off the coast and about 15 minutes from The Villas.   We could not believe just how many there were and we followed them for ages.   We also went to Les Waterfall which is close by and an easy walk, just the right amount of exercise to deal with the delicious breakfast and make way for lunch !  
Their Spa is also excellent and I can recommend a massage.  Snorkeling first thing in the morning before a late breakfast was amazing and so close to shore with water a great temperature and so many fish and so much coral to see. 
All of the staff here are simply amazing and I could not fault anything at all about my stay apart from the fact that it was simply not long enough.    Wayan and Budi, the Managers are the 2 most wonderful people I have ever met in a Resort and I look forward to seeing them again soon.    Do yourself a favour and make the effort to come and stay here - it is a remarkable place.
title: WOW - I FOUND HEAVEN ON EARTH!

text:
This place is paradise. Initially I was hesitant in travelling to a place I hadn't heard much of and that was so far out but there is not one regret, this place is stunning, the staff are amazing.

We stayed in the Villa Tirta. Luxurious down to the smallest details.  You walk in the the secure locked villa, with a private pool, shared kitchen and lounge area (which is large, spacious and immaculate). The rooms are beautiful, spacious, cool and the bathroom is a dream. 

The staff catered to every need. We booked our tours through The Villas, after asking around locally, the prices are unbeatable and the standards of Wayan and Budhi are above all. 

We did the Dolphin tour, which was to a different location than suggested by others (Lovina-which tends to be overcrowded). There were three other boats and three species of dolphins. It was quiet, peaceful and we were even provided with a beautiful fruit basket.

We ate almost all of our meals at the restaurant run by the Villa Warung Kelapa, not because it was convenient but because it was fantastic. We have some difficult dietary requirements which were all catered for. The staff even went to the markets after finding out our love of avocado for breakfast. Coconut milk was used to replace any dairy and all sugar was removed from the meals. The ribs are a must (12 hours notice must be given).

There is an onsite spa in a gorgeous little Balinese hut. Couples massages are available and you can even ask to have the massage out on the deck shares facing the ocean. 

It was the most relaxing time I have ever spent away and I didn't want to leave.

I would highly recommend this place to all of you're wishing to escape the rat race or you want a paradise and still keep in touch with family (wifi throughout the Villa and the grounds).
title: Incredible experience

text:
What a perfect spot. 

Tejakula is so refreshingly peaceful and quiet away from the hustle and bustle of Southern Bali. 

The location is beautiful as you will see from the photos and it is just as well kept and manicured as you see in the pictures. There is a reef to snorkel or fish on just 30m out from the resort. 

The Villas themselves are gorgeous. So modern with a beautiful big bathroom, very comfortable bed and great air-conditioning. The private pool is so nice on a hot day and the ocean temperature is like a warm bath. The living area is so big and spacious and has everything you could possibly need and more. 

The attention to detail from the staff is exceptional. Whether it be remembering your name and plans, remembering your favourite food (and catering for special requests) or helping you organise a day trip. The food in the restaurant is fantastic and they are so willing to cater for your every request. 

Tejakula itself is fantastic. It isn't touristy at all so there isnt much in the way of shops or restaurants. There are still a few places where you can get a great massage though and at least one local warung that is clean and tidy. The local traditional markets are a great spot to buy some local fruit and produce very cheaply. Hire s scooter from The Villas very cheaply and go explore thevregion on your own. There are lots of tours to do be it seeing the temples, the mountains, the lakes, the volcano or even the hot springs. The staff ate super helpful organising it for you with very proffessional drivers and give great tips. Little things like providing you with a sarong to enter the temple with are always taken care of. Go out and see the dolphins, there are three different kinds and heaps of them.
title: Heaven

text:
An amazing place 

Wayan and Budi are the most gracious hosts

Beautiful garden

Comfortable room 

Delicious food 

Decent massage 

Great tours of close by areas 

Don't miss doing the dolphin sight seeing - incredible to see so many dolphins on a boat by yourselves 

The staff were very helpful throughout the stay 

Thoroughly recommend this establishment
title: So relaxing, very friendly

photos.caption: Dolphins everywhere, delicious food and amazing waterfall to yourself
Dolphins everywhere, delicious food and amazing waterfall to yourself
Dolphins everywhere, delicious food and amazing waterfall to yourself
Dolphins everywhere, delicious food and amazing waterfall to yourself
Dolphins everywhere, delicious food and amazing waterfall to yourself
Dolphins everywhere, delicious food and amazing waterfall to yourself

text:
Everything about this place was perfect! 
We chose to come here mainly for the fact that we thought it would be nice and quiet and for the snorkelling. 
You could not ask for a nicer spot right on the beachfront. The place was beautifully thought out with great attention to all the little details. The beachfront gardens were beautiful with loungers laid out looking out to sea. A lovely spot for an evening drink while watching the sunset, before dinner in their amazing restaurant! All the food we had there was so delicious. The breakfast had lots of great options. And plenty of it! Loads of yummy things for lunch and we had some really good fish dinners. Especially the whole tuna which we shared with another couple one of the nights. And the black rice pudding! Unfortunately we weren't here long enough to try everything!
All the staff were so lovely. I was blown away with how friendly, happy and helpful everyone who we met was. Not just here, but in Bali in general! But especially here! You could not ask for nicer people to look after you than Wayan and Budi!
The accommodation here is unbelievable! There is a private pool and outdoor kitchen living area that you would usually share with another double room. We were lucky enough to get the whole area to ourselves! The pool area is gorgeous. With beautifully maintained plants and pool. The bed was enormous! And so comfy. Well air conditioned room. Immaculate bathroom.
I am very grateful to my boyfriend for doing the research before hand and finding this beauty of a place! We really couldn't have asked for more.
 We were in Bali for 8 nights. We went to Ubud, Amed and then here. It wasn't too far to travel for such a short time. Its easy enough to find a taxi driver and they all seem to be excellent drivers!
 The pictures don't do it justice! You must go and see for yourself!
title: Unbeatable!!!

text:
We had an outstanding and memorable 4-night stay. Why? For many reasons:

First, the 2-bedroom villas with shared 10-metre pool and living-dining-kitchen area are truly luxurious in design and furnishing. Everything is new, high-quality and meticulously cared for. Great thought and taste went into the layout and comfort of the space. We loved the high-peaked ceilings in the AC-cooled bedroom and fan-and-fresh-air-cooled living-dining-kitchen. The king-sized bed is extremely comfortable. The kitchen area is well equipped should you choose to prepare yourself a meal; however, we gave it no thought, other than using the coffee provided: there was no point because the restaurant satisfied us entirely 3-times a day, every day. The pool and plants are impeccably maintained, and the outdoor art (as the indoor) is well chosen. Shade and sun are available all day in different areas of your private enclosure.

Second, the location of the property is ideal : walk down the steps directly to the ocean and a coral reef with a lovely variety of coral and small fish only a few metres away.
Don't expect a sandy beach in these parts. The narrow beach at low tide consists of black pebbles and rocks and is exceptionally clean. The absence of sand was not an issue for us, as we came to snorkel - snorkelling gear is available (scuba gear and excursions can be organized metres away at a dive resort). We loved being away from the frenzy of south Bali, in this serene, under-touristed part of Bali. Our few outside activities included attending prayers one evening with the locals at the nearby Hindhu temple (very worthwhile - ask about it), visiting the early-morning locals' market, and wallking along the seawall to the East at at least one km. Other guests much enjoyed their scooter rental, trip to nearby Les Falls, massages and water excursion on the resort's beautiful jukung.

Third, the comon grounds are beautifully vegetated with an attractive collection of trees and plants and are perfectly maintained by a gardener. There are several spots to sit and enjoy sun or shade, and a cooling breeze.

Fourth, as noted above, we so enjoyed the food prepared at the restaurant that we did not consider cooking ourselves nor investigating any other food options in thhe area. The breakfasts were extremely plentiful and generousWe ate lightly at lunch and found plenty of choices. Evening meals benefitted from the easy availability of fresh fish
(e.g., tuna, squid, prawns, etc.) prepared in a variety of ways. 

Finally, owners Wayan and Budi, and every staff member went out of their way to make our stay a wonderful and special experience. They were friendly, helpful, caring, never intrusive and always eager and able to please.

Should you be lucky enough to stay here (make it at least several days), you will remember it forever. Don't be put off by the distance from Denpasar or Ubud: let the Villas at Tejakula take care of the transportation. It is an enjoyable drive up, with many potential stops along the way.
title: A true gem away from it all!

text: Having stayed at Villa Saraswati in Ubud and seen the brochure on this wonderful place I just had to find out what it was like.    I have never been to this part of Bali before but know now that I have really missed out by not having done so.    The location on the beach is stunning, to go swimming and snorkeling on the wonderful coral reef just metres from the shore was an almost daily activity and almost like meditation.    Then there is the spa, what can I say but that there is nothing better than being pampered with a massage or facial and hearing the sound of the waves in the background.   The food here is amazing and without a doubt some of the best that I had in Bali and I have to mention just how clean everything is, from the kitchen in the waring to the Villas and their beautiful grounds.   They are now commencing small yoga classes on request and take the time to introduce you to the highlights of the area.    I just loved my time here and I will definitely be back.
title: SOOOO RELAXING RIGHT ON THE SEA

text: If you want to appreciate the Bali of yesterday, where the cacophony of scooters and the peddling of souvenirs is non existent then head to the north coast. What makes the villas so special? Your kind and gracious hosts who treat you like an old friend. Warm, welcoming and always ready to help. The past reviews are spot on so no need to repeat what they have already said. Get there before it becomes popular. Forget Kuta and the likes and see the real Bali.
title: Paradise

text:
This is my first ever review of a hotel I stayed in. 

Usually I am either not that fond of the hotel or I feel the rating is already correctly reflected on major sites, so writing a review is not worth the effort - not so with The Villas Tejakula. 

We are a couple in our early thirties and love to travel, usually staying in 5* resorts. In order to see some of the main sights in northern Bali (lovina dolphins, kintamani, Mr batur sunrise trek etc), we tried to find a resort with similarly high standards but were unable to. I booked The Villas Tejakula as the only place with good ratings in the area, setting my expectations fairly low - and boy was I wrong!

The property itself is located in a village far away from tourists, in-between local shops and next to the ocean. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The property has a common area with a little restaurant and sun loungers next to the sea, as well as individual villas with 2 BR, a big outside living room / kitchen area and a private pool, which you will share if booking a room or have to yourself if booking a villa. The rooms themselves are really nice (nicer than most 5* properties I stayed at recently), and the pool area is gorgeous!

While the hotel itself already has lots of great qualities (great facilities, massage, food, snorkelling), the best part about is are its hosts Budi and Wayan and the rest of the staff - they have done everything possible to make our stay as amazing as possible, and we cannot thank them enough. 

This morning for example, I wanted to do the sunrise trekking of mount batur; Budi was waiting for me in the car at 2.30 am, with sandwiches, fruits and water, ready to go. His wife had organised a guide, and while I was busy trekking with the guide, Budi waited for me in the car for 5 hours, to make sure I came back home safely. When I got back to the villa, I went for a nap, only to find Budi offering fresh fish they had organised for all guests interested for dinner. 

I have never felt so welcome. Can only recommend to anyone stopping by this amazing place!
title: Hospitality at its finest

text:
We stayed there in August for 5 nights
The place is very well taken care of. Communal area, garden, restaurant etc are very tidy and well maintained.
The garden and the restaurant is just in front of the sea which offers amazing and relaxing views. It is also great for diving (there is a dive center next door operated by germans) you can just walk in and manage to reach great diving spots without using the boats to reach them - great dive are guaranteed among the best in Bali.
The beach is made of rocks which is beautiful but don't expect a sandy beach. The Villas provide rock/corail shoes, fins etc….
The Villas are all the same, very spacious with a very nice shower room and offer one swimming pool for two villas (with a large extensive patio with kitchen, fridge etc….) We were lucky as we had the communal area only for us for 4 nights which results of us having our own private swimming pool.
My advice would be to book two villas with friends or another couple to fully enjoy it - that would be the perfect way to enjoy the pool, drinking something nice around it and chatting.
The Villas also offers various of excursion but be aware there are a bit far (+- 2 hours with the car one-way - even if the sightseeing are close in KM +- 60, the traffic and road are pretty mad in Bali) We did the waterfall close by which is a 2 hours journey max (driving + walking) and totally worth it as the waterfall is very high.
There is also a local market 30min by foot which is really worth seeing to get a glimpse of the local way of life.
The Villas offer massage treatment which are great value for money (they were very cheap in comparison to Europe standard and even in comparison to Bali standard- and quite nice) we did treatment everyday.

The only down side would be for me the lack of food options around the Villas so you quickly end up eating there everyday at their restaurant Warung (which is ok but not fantastic but the price are good value)

The service at all level was very good, friendly and staff always try to make our stay the nicest possible - we thank them for their very kind hospitality

In conclusion, we had a very relaxing stay and if you're looking for an escape from bustling Ubud or Semiyiak in a more authentic part of the island, this is a great option. Also a great dive option.
I would definitely recommend it for a long w-e trip or a stop over of few days in a trip around Bali!
title: Great value for money in a more authentic part of Bali

text:
My partner Emma and I had a delightful stay at the Villas during our recent trip to Bali.  As soon as we arrived, we were made to feel welcome by Wayan, Budi and the whole staff - who are always ready to help, whilst also giving you space to relax and unwind.  

The villas themselves are superb.  They are only a year old and easily the standard of a luxury hotel.  We were lucky and had a whole villa to ourselves, with plenty of space to relax, sunbathe, read and a private pool to swim in.  Each kitchen has a fridge stocked with beer, water and soft drinks - and much needed ice cold glasses to keep them cold! The bedrooms are extremely spacious with very comfortable beds and the shower in the bathroom is very good (makes all the difference!)

The restaurant is set in beautiful, well maintained gardens - and the food served was superb.  It was genuinely some of the best food we had in Bali - from fresh whole tuna BBQ'd especially for us to delicious chicken salads.  We didn't even consider eating elsewhere as it was so good!

There are plenty of options for things to do nearby and Wayan and Budi were more than happy to talk through them with us.  Budi arranged for our sunrise climb of Mt Batur, and also a trip for us to visit the Royal Baths on the trip back to Ubud - well worth a stop if you're going the scenic route.

We had a wonderful time at the Villas - and look forward to going back again!  Thank you Wayan, Budi and the whole team for making it so special for us!
title: Paradise!

photos.caption: A freshly caught and BBQ'd tuna - delicious!
The private pool in Villa Ganesha

text: I was fortunate to stay in Villa Sawaswati in Ubud for four days and then took up their online offer of one of their "hot deals" to stay at the Villas Tejakula. I was certainly not disappointed.  The whole trip was an enormous success and I got to see some of the real Bali.  The northern coast is so different from the craziness of Ubud.  The people are lovely, the setting superb.  Thanks to a foot injury, I could not walk far - at the Villas everything I could possibly want was within a few metres.  There is a lovely outdoor warung serving delicious food and a spa on site for massage and other therapies.  The Villas are totally private and the swimming pool and set up of the rooms of the highest standard - I would have expected nothing less from such exacting owners of both places. The wifi worked very well and I was able to stay in touch, plus listen to favorite radio or tv programs on my iPad. My book consumption went up immeasurably!  If you want total relaxation with gracious service and a beautiful setting this is the place. Can't wait to go back. Highly recommended.
title: Just what the doctor ordered!

text:
Our secure complex consisted of two rooms which shared a pool and open air kitchen / dining area. As we were the only guests we had exclusive use of the whole area which was amazing, so relaxing and peaceful it was difficult to leave the confines of the villa. The villas are separated from the warang and ocean front by a small road, but there is virtually no traffic and whilst sitting around your pool you can still hear the waves from the ocean. The villa itself has all modern amenities with a good quality bed and shower. 
All the staff are extremely friendly and helpful without being overbearing and in your face which could have been an issue with us being the only guests. The food was good quality and plentiful (particularly the breakfast). They are more than happy to adapt things from the menu and we had fresh seafood cooked on the BBQ twice during our stay. I also had a Balinese massage which I would recommend. 
As we had toured round Bali before our stay we were happy to spend most of our time just relaxing in the villa. They did organise our sunrise trek up Mount Batur and we took short walks into the village and along the ocean to see the numerous fishing boats. We also used their transportation service and felt very safe in their hands.
If you want a small 5* retreat on the ocean  away from the hustle and bustle of the larger resorts I would thoroughly recommend a stay here. We felt everything from the cost of the accommodation, food, trips, etc was all excellent value for money. 
Thank you Wayan, Budi and all your staff for a lovely end to our stay in Bali.
title: Peaceful Retreat on the Ocean

text: This was our first trip to the villas, it was just breathtaking, from the moment you get out of the car and look around you immediately feel like  your in  paradise. The villas are amazing and the bathroom and shower just delightful. Sitting by the ocean on a deck chair just looking out is so peaceful and relaxing. The gardens are meticulously maintained, the whole experience is just tranquil and pure relaxation. The food is wonderful it is so fresh with wonderful flavours. We would have loved to go snorkeling unfortunately the ocean was a little to rough. All the staff were very friendly and obliging. It was the best place to end our holiday to Bali. Thank you Dean & Robin and all the wonderful staff.
title: Tranquil and pure relaxation

text: Best Stay ever! This Place is just amazing! Budi, Wayan and the hole team are so friendly, helpfull and so nice - we felt so welcomed. The Villa with the pool are totally clean, modern with a nice balinese touch! The private Beach is wonderfull for snorkelling, my opinion the best spot we went snorkeling at Bali. The Food is delicious and everyone does his best to fulfil your every wish and whim. We really didn't want to leave this amazing place, but had already booked the next place, otherwise we would have stayed longer. All this little details at the Villas are so wonderfull and the hole Team seems to be a big Family! The Breakfast is just amazing! A big thanks to Budi, who picked us up from Amed and Wayan for the organization and the wonderful stay at the Villas Tejakula. Your team and your place is amazing, I really hope that a lot of people will visit you! Guys you really have to go there, you can relax at the beach or your pool; you can rent a moto to go to Danau Batur or Danau Bratan; or you book one of this amazing trips which are offered from Wayan and Budi! Really everything ist perfect at the Villas Tejakula - we definitely will come back!
title: Breathtaking! Just amazing stay on the North Coast of Bali

text: This was a great place to stay at, they did everything for us, they planned a trip for us up Mount Batur and then they had a bbq feast for us in the evening. Great place, beautiful surroundings, great room service and the best villas with a private pool. There was nothing around the villas so this is a place to stay in, by the pool with a Bintang. I also have to say that the rooms were really nicely decorated and you can tell from far away that this is all new.
title: The highest level of hospitality

text: The wow factor struck immediately on arrival and lasted the entire stay.  This is the movie-star luxury experience you've dreamed of.  A perfect honeymoon destination, romantic escape for couples or in fact perfect for anyone seeking relaxation in 5* luxury.  Just 4 private villas, each of which may be rented as a whole or as one of two individual bedroom suites with its own large and spectacular private bathroom - inside each villa's secluded walled garden, two bedroom suites (one at either end) are beautifully decorated and furnished, with high quality finish and immaculate cleanliness. The two suites share a private 10m pool, sundecks with shade should you prefer and a large open lounge sitting area.  Book the villa and its all yours, book a room and you may share the pool and sitting area with maximum one other.  In this case, the garden area is so spacious that there is plenty of privacy, with individual areas at either end alongside your own suite.  If you're lucky, you may get the whole villa to yourself anyway.  Between the villas and the ocean are the most immaculate, pretty tropical gardens in amongst a coconut grove - here you'll find the spa (the Balinese massage is a MUST) and the small restaurant, where every single meal we ate was beautifully presented, high quality and most importantly very tasty.  Wayan, Budi and their beautiful, small team of staff deliver at every opportunity...that gentle, attentive Balinese hospitality.  The attention to detail here raises the standard to the very highest, whether that be the frangipani petals scattered on our pool, the unlimited drinking water provided, the nightwatchman who lowers your extra blind to ensure absolute darkness and a good night sleep....or the fascinating leaf patterns in the concrete flooring.  For anyone itching to explore, there is great snorkelling just a few metres out front - a dive centre next door caters to divers, and Budi and Wayan offer a range of inexpensive daytours.  Ubud is only 2 hours drive, for example.  But we went nowhere ... and loved every minute !!
title: Wow factor, luxury private villas on the quiet North coast of Bali

text: In selecting The Villas Tejakula, we were looking for three things: something very nice (luxurious, private, quiet, great food), within an hour's drive of northeastern Bali's main sites (volcanoes, waterfalls, snorkeling and diving spots, temples), and far removed from the chaos of Denpasar and southern Bali. The Villas are exactly what we hoped they'd be and hands down our best decision while traveling through Indonesia was to stay here! The two Indonesian proprietors, Budi and Wayan, as well as their lovely staff, were fun to be around, professional, efficient, and great conversationalists. My wife and I immediately felt right at home and always looked forward to our interactions with them. It's worth mentioning that, given that there are only eight rooms, at any one time the place is never busy and the staff always have time to accommodate your needs and wishes. The rooms themselves are amazing: modern, equipped, comfortable, great bathroom, no bugs, super clean, etc. We reserved both units (each villa has two units) for ourselves, which was perfect because we had the huge common living area and swimming pool all to ourselves. If you can splurge, it's absolutely worth it to secure the extra, private space. Plus, two friends of ours decided to stay in our other unit the last two nights, and it was great to have the flexibility to offer them that option. The property itself is very well attended (Budi's brother the gardener does an amazing job). While there is no beach at the property - or on northern and especially north-eastern Bali for that matter - due to the volcanic explosions of decades past that left the beaches strewn with black rocks, The Villas Tejakula have built their property right to the water and with amazing views of the coast. The snorkeling in front of the property is arguably the second-best we encountered in Bali (after Amed) and the best parts are literally 30 meters off shore right in front of Warung Kelapa, the restaurant contained within the property itself. Plus, you're a 40-minute drive from the shipwreck at Tulamben, and a 55-minute drive from the nicest beaches and amazing diving and snorkeling of Amed. Finally, the food at Warung Kelapa is great and varied and each day we tried something different. In terms of considerations before booking your stay, four in particular come to mind: 1) the wi-fi, while free, is slow and intermittent; 2) with the exception of the neighboring hotel literally 10 meters from The Villas Tejakula, there are few restaurant or hotel options in the region; 3) the wine in Bali is pretty bad and I recommend you bring your own; and 4) make sure The Villas Tejakula find you local drivers, which they're happy to do at a very reasonable price for a daily rate, that know the region, speak English, and can ably recommend sites to see and things to do along the way. Otherwise, I highly recommend: Sekumpul Waterfalls, the Tulamben shipwreck (great snorkeling or diving, either way), diving and snorkeling at Amed Beach, the Surya Indigo women's art cooperative, and simply driving a scooter along the road from beach to beach to find a nice view and some great fried fish.
title: Best accomodations in northeast Bali, hands down

text:
The Villas Tejakula is a perfect, very small, elegant boutique hotel at a bargain price. It consists of 8 rooms in four 2-bedroom villas, each with a private pool and living area. You may share your villa with other guests, or you may be lucky enough to have it to yourself. Even if shared it is a wonderful setup. 

The hotel is on the ocean with views to the horizon. Decent snorkeling right from the doorstep. And the staff will arrange any excursion you can dream up, and offer plenty of suggestions from fishing to trekking to sightseeing. 

The onsite restaurant is great. We were there 3 days and felt no need to search out any place else to eat. All meals were excellent and a few were spectacular. 

The staff is exceptional, warm and friendly without hovering. The hotel is only a year old and beautiful. There are no discordant notes, the art and furnishings are elegant. No weeds, no trash on the beach, nothing to criticize. 

It's not a place for everyone though. It's a bit remote. If you want to go out in the evening, there's not really any place to go. But if you want to sit on the oceanside, or with your feet in your private pool, as you watch the stars come out, it's just perfect. 

We have traveled a lot, and The Villas Tejakula stands out as exceptional.
title: Not a hair out of place

text:
We enjoyed 5 nights staying in the beautiful villas managed by Wayan and Budi and were treated like part of their family. There are just 4 high quality villas each with two rooms separated by an open kitchen area along side a private pool. We booked the entire villa Baruna for our family of 4.
We quickly got to know the friendly staff who helped us with local information, taught us some Balinese and even bought interesting fruit from the market for us to try. 
We went snorkelling and fishing in the villa boat as well as off the black pebble beach.
In Tejakula we came across a Balinese funeral ceremony and followed the procession down to the beach. We played with the Balinese children while we waited for the burning ceremony.
There is little organised tourism in the area. We visited the Sekumpul waterfall and ate in a local warung and the adjacent resort one night. We brought fresh fish from the market and cooked it in our villa. We also had great massages in the newly opened onsite spa. Wayan and Budi invited us to attend a big ceremony at their local temple and lent us sarongs, sashes and head wear to attend.

Highly recommended stay in the quieter north east if Bali.

PS if driving from Ubud don't go via the
title: 5 star luxury villas with fantastic personal service

text:
Tejakula is far from the typical Bali tourist areas, but so worth the drive. When you finally pull in you will be amazed. This is a great place to go on a honeymoon, to rest and relax or to snorkel and dive. There is a reef right in front of the Villas.
The owners are Australian (Robin and Dean), while the managers are Balinese (Wayan and Budi). Every last detail has been addressed in each villa. The decor is stunning, and every amenity available (right down to pool noodles!). There is a restaurant on-site (run by the same people) with excellent food. 
The atmosphere is very family-like. We had many great chats with the owners and managers. When we arrived we were ill with Bali Belly. They took wonderful care of us and sent toast and rice from the restaurant at no charge to us. It was a great place to recover, although the closest pharmacy was an hour away (if traveling in Bali, don't underestimate the power of a bacterial intestinal bug and make sure you come equipped with the appropriate medications). When I was finally able to eat normal food, the restaurant (Warung Kelapa) made a palatable dish just for me (pesto), and then added it to the menu!
The beach is a rocky, black sand beach. There are beach chairs on the property where you can look out at the Bali Sea. Each villa also has a cute and clean pool. We enjoyed walking on the beach and engaging with the local children who are adorable. They will willingly pose for pictures and practice their few English phrases with you.
If you want to see more than the Bali tourist traps, I highly recommend a trip to the north!!
title: Five days in paradise!

photos.caption: Part of the living room area

text: What a place, great villa with private pool. Very clean and comfortable. A warm welcome from Wayan en Buddi and staff. Surroundings beautiful and the small restaurant is very good. Specially the fresh tuna from the grill is outstanding.
title: Heaven on earth

text: Heaven is a place on earth...and it can be found at The Villas Tejakula. - Wonderfully designed villas - Peace and serenity - Incredibly accommodating hosts (Wayan and her husband Budi) - Very high standards set by the owners: cleanliness and comfort were second to none - Perfect location; with the ocean on your doorstep - The best restaurant in Bali, with wonderful Indonesian dishes and the best Spaghetti Bolognese I've had outside of Rome! Be sure to book your spa treatments and massages; we had treatments almost every day!
title: Heaven is a place on earth...

text:
We really fell in love with the place when staying here. The standard of the villas beat any 5* hotels that I have stayed in! We stayed as a group of 4 and really did not want to leave. After travelling around Bali for a few weeks we chose this as our final destination, best choice we made! 
We were looked after for the entire stay by Wayan and Budi who went above and beyond when we needed a little help with a few things and we can't thank them enough! There is a fantastic group of people working at the villas and we really could not find one bad thing to say. The food is also delicious and we are there most days after having some terrible food at other places not too far away. 
It was also great to talk to the owners about how that started up the villas and the snorkelling which is great just a few metres off the beach. Budi also organised a few trips for us which were great. I would definitely recommend going on the dolphin sightseeing trip. 
I would defiantly stay here again next time we visit Bali and would not hesitate to tell friends visiting about this hidden gem 
Thank you so much for making our stay enjoyable! 
Katie
title: A place you never want to leave!

text:
This place delivers the WOW factor on so many levels.
Luxuriously furnished both inside and out,nothing has been overlooked.
We were quite blown away by the balance of professionalism and warmth offered by the wonderful staff ably headed by Budi and Wayan.
The delightful Weda selects produce from the local market on a daily basis so meals are always fresh and healthy.
Iluh(a trained therapist) provides a range of spa treatments in a most relaxing setting.
And directly in front of the villas,thru the lovely gardens,the snorkelling is a must.
We'll remember this total experience for a long time.
title: Simply stunning

text: Wow! We travelled around Bali (stayed at 5 star hotels and other airbnb villas all over the island) and without a doubt this accommodation was the best. The staff were fantastic, by the end of our stay we felt like family and it felt very sad to leave. The villa itself was stunning, we booked the whole villa so we had it to ourselves (which we'd recommend) such great attention to detail, even down to a music playlist provided and fairly priced drinks and snacks. The pool was the perfect temperature, the villa and grounds were meticulously clean and you felt so well looked after. This village in Tejakula felt like the 'real' Bali, very few tourists and it was such a pleasure seeing the day to day life of the locals (particularly the school children and the early morning market). We snorkeled in the sea in front of the villa and in Tulamben near by, lots of coral and the USA Liberty ship wreck really blew us away! Budi took us to the waterfall which was magical, you must go. The food was fantastic, lots of fresh fish caught that day. We both had excellent (and great value!) spa treatments which were so luxurious with the sound of the birds and sea just outside! We never go back to the same place twice but I have a suspicion that we might, one day, end up back at the Villas Tejakula! Thank you so much for everything Wayan, Budi and the whole team, you were all so lovely. When it's raining in busy London we will remember beautiful Tejakula and your stunning villas.
title: We totally fell in love with this place, so beautiful and relaxing, the 'real' Bali!

photos.caption: Sunrise from the front of the villas. Well worth getting up early for!
Amazing snorkelling in Tulamben nearby, this is my partner investigating the USA Liberty Wreck.
The waterfall, just down the road.

text:
If it wasn't for the Volcano, we would never have stayed at these villas, and we are so glad we did If your'e sick of the people asking you , TAXI, MASSAGE, etc, you will love this place.
Right by the ocean these villas are just bliss, and we wished we had of gone earlier, and spent more time there.
But now we have found it, next time it will be our first port of call.
Fun thing is, its more like going to stay with family, and we appreciate it.
CHEERS
title: VOLCANO #$%*

text: Very very enjoyable, relax and memorable 6 nights & 7 days stay. We are a family with 13 years old son and occupied one Villa which consists of two spacey bedrooms together with bathrooms, an open-air Living-Dining-Kitchen and a private pool/garden. The Villa is surrounded by walls and fences and security/privacy is 100% guaranteed so we can even swim naked! Hospitality, services, food, beach and all are amazing. One additional bonus point is that a diving center is located at just next door and our boy successfully completed a Junior Open Water Diver course (4 day session). Going back to Bali and staying in this facility again is definitely one of my Bucket List items. Wayan and Budi, I love you guys! Dean, Robyn, thank you for your hospitality!
title: Hidden Gem

text: My fiancé and I stayed in Villas Tejakula for five nights in June this year.  Having intentionally chosen this out of the way place so that we could unwind from our busy lives back home, we were not to be disappointed. As soon as we arrived we knew we were going to do just that.  We were shown to our beautiful private villa and pool and were completely amazed at how beautiful and private it was.  The rooms are very spacious with comfortable king size beds, and big semi-outdoor bathrooms with double sinks.  Each villa has a lovely outdoor living area for relaxing, enjoying a beer, or reading a book, not to mention its own beautiful private pool and sun lounges.   Everything has been thought of for your comfort: from the fridge stacked with refreshments, to the lovely big towels, to reading material and a stack of cards to amuse you during a lazy afternoon.   The staff are vey friendly and always happy to help.  All meals are eaten at the onsite ‘Warung’ (restaurant) with beautiful views of the ocean and the immaculately manicured gardens. The food is delicious and lovingly prepared; the breakfast highlight being the tasty banana pancake and the dinner highlight being the most amazing salt and pepper squid, followed by the signature coconut pancakes.  Thank you to the owners Robyn and Dean who made us feel so welcome.  A spa was in construction during our stay and once this is finished this place will be the ultimate in relaxation.   If you are looking for peace and tranquillity, privacy and a place simply to unwind, this is the place to go.
title: Pure relaxation

photos.caption: The private pool outside our villa

text: With heavy heart we prepare to leave this beautiful location in Tejakula with a promise to return next year. The Villas are impeccable to the last detail with tasteful furnishings that reflect the relaxed environment with private lap pool, full size fridge and coffee, tea, cooking facilities with endless fresh water included. Warung Kelupa, on the Oceanside, provides your daily breakfast and has a delicious menu for Lunch & Dinner using the freshest ingredients collected daily. Must haves are the Slow Cooked BBQ ribs, fresh Tuna, King Prawns & Salt & Pepper Squid. Balinese breakfast is available along with delicious local dishes with special touches from chef Made. Sensational snorkeling only 30 Metres from shore and the Villas have their own boat available for excursions & fishing. Interesting tours are available to explore surrounding towns & we thank Wayan & Budi for inviting us to share in local ceremonies at the Clan House. Special thanks to all the staff at the Villas for a warm welcome & looking after our every need with a friendly smile. Owners, Robyn & Dean have done an amazing job creating this holiday destination for travelers to enjoy this unique region in Bali. Highly recommended!
title: Paradise on the North Coast of Bali

text: I can not stress enough how important it is to have wonderful staff and excellent service. The staff members are fantastic. If you want a clean and a pleasant stay I would recommend going here. The food is also excellent.
title: Villa Stay

text:
I have had a great stay here. The staff was excellent, the rooms brand new and beautiful facilities. I enjoyed the fishing, snorkelling and the trips to the waterfall and the little restaurants in the surroundings of the resort.
All and all it was a wonderful experience being here and I will definitely come back and bring the rest of the family.
Alex from Belanda
title: Excellent resort in a beautiful part of Bali

text: Read the Aussie owners have the #1 rated B&B in Ubud so we booked 4 nights at The Villas Tejakula and were treated to a luxurious stay in a beautiful, comfortable King Room. It was pleasantly much more than I expected. The staff were beyond excellent. Provided me with true Bali memories including an invitation to a local traditional wedding, knowledge of the local language, culture and village, great massages at my villa, and lasting freindships. The host were attentive to our needs. The quality of these new villas were impressive, surrounded by wonderful landscaping, great snorkeling right off the beach weather permitting,  restful peace and quiet away from the usual tourist hustle. If you are looking for great value and relaxation while in Bali, look no further.
title: Best of my Bali Accomodations

text:
We choose the Deluxe King room in our trip with The Villas Tejakula for two days. It's in a villa with two bedrooms, one living room and one private pool. During our stay, there's no other guest in the other room. So we can own the whole facilities in the villa. The room is very new and clean. The environment is quiet and cozy. You can enjoy the ocean and jungle atmosphere at the same time. 
In front of the villas, there's a snorkelling spot. It's better to go to snorkel in the morning since the water is cleaner. There are many big coral reefs in Angel Canyon. We also go to snorkel in Tulamben, you can see the ship wreck and many fish and coral reefs. It's about 30 minutes drive.
The staffs are very kind and helpful, especially Budi and Wayan. With their hospitality, we don't have to worry about anything. We really enjoy everything in the villas Tejakula. Definitely will come back again.
title: Wonderful stay with the villas and staffs

text:
This place really has to be seen to be believed. We booked in advance purely on the reviews I read...but nothing could have prepared me for the reality. I don't think I have ever been so blown away by a hotel as much as this one. It truly is jaw droppingly amazing and I half expected someone to come along and say 'no, only joking, you're down the road aways,' 

We had the two bedroom villa with private pool as we were a family. This would also be perfect for two couples traveling together as the bedrooms are at opposite ends of the villa divided by an open air living/dining area with a fully fitted kitchen, for those of you who wish to cook the fish you caught earlier in the day presumably...

As commented earlier, the photos don't do it justice, which just makes it that more special when you are confronted with the reality.

Wayan, the manager is an absolute gem, as are the rest of the staff. My only advice would be, book while you can, because once the word gets out, you won't be able to get in.
title: 10 out of 10 reviewers so far gave a perfect 5*, mine makes it 11!

text: Had a blissful stay in these gorgeous new concept villas with fabulous staff and a delightful restaurant with ocean views. Everything about these villas are perfect...they are both spacious and beautiful. Our children swam constantly in the private swimming pool inside our own villa, and snorkelled in the calm ocean directly in front of us for most of the day. Although there are many sights nearby including waterfalls and markets, we were so comfortable we didn't leave the premises! Thank you for an unforgettable holiday!
title: Amazing villa and stunning snorkelling

text:
After visting a friends village we decided to stop by and have lunch - the food was delicious,and the grounds were superb and picture perfect that we decided to stay in a two bedroom villa for the night before carrying on our adventure. and what a surprise when you walk through the doors- a beautiful spacious tranquil villa. the rooms were lovely and the bathroom was bigger than most hotel rooms with a very hot shower( winning!!) and a private pool.
We had the pleasure of meeting Wayan and her husband and the Australian owners who all were very friendly and very helpful.
The pebble black rock beach out front is great to see if you come from Australia as we don't have beaches like that at home.
We would definitely be back next year.
title: A tranquil hideaway

text: We stopped by for a couple of night at the Villas Tejakulas on a visit of different dive spots of the island, and I wished we had stayed longer. The quality, beauty of the villas are way beyond what the pictures on the web let you imagine. Additionally the place is brand new and spotless, and each villa offers lots of space whether in the bedroom or in covered sitting areas (with kitchen corner with coffee etc..) or by the pool.  It has a garden along the sea from where you can directly go snorkelling or diving.  We did a couple of dives and it was better than I expected with great corals (check out the "coral canyon") and some interesting activity on the micro side. The food at the restaurant was very good (excellent desserts and home made bread) and that was a nice experience after the crap food we had in Tulamben. In the end I felt this is a perfect place for relaxing vacations and taking a good break (while enjoying a few easy dives). As a matter of fact as it is only 35 to 40 minutes from Tulamben I wished we had stayed there longer and visited Tulamben only a day or two for the Liberty dive.
title: Pictures don't do justice to this place

text:
After staying in Ubud twice, I thought it was time to explore a little bit more of Bali. There is no place more serene and private than Tejakula. A hidden haven in the middle of the northern coast of Bali. 

You won't believe your eyes when you are handed the keys and walk inside the Villa. You'll be greeted with a massive bedroom with an unbelievably comfortable king size bed. Adjacent to the bedroom is a large bathroom (twice the size of my bedroom back home!) with an open shower, toilet and twin vanity units. The way the bathroom is designed is with cloudy glass on the back of the shower and then an open part of the wall near the roof - it gives the feeling of showering outside when you can see the sun streaming through the cloudy glass and open wall while still maintaining complete privacy. 

Next comes an open-living kitchen and living area that is completely open to your own private pool. the kitchen allows you to do your own cooking (if you so desire - there is an amazing restaurant less than a minute walk from your Villa that can be charged straight to your room!), a large hand crafted wooden table and lounge chairs. This is where you can see the attention to detail put into your room. A large 18L fresh water bottle sits on the bench for you to refill your own water at your convenience (and the 18L will be replaced when you finish it - no need to pay for water!!), complimentary tea, coffee, biscuits and sweets (replenished daily), ice and cold glasses that are refilled and replaced daily and your own full-size fridge - stocked with treats that can be purchased for very reasonable prices or bring your own.
